Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here for business”
Reviews.Author: aka217
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference and overpaid significantly given the product. The rooms were gritty, the hotel was dark, the amenities were extremely limited. They did not have room service, if you got food from the restuarant you couldn't charge it to your room and they don't serve breakfast. It's basically a room to sleep in. My room in particular was next to the fire escape which made me feel very unsafe since there was a door to the outside right outside my room. The noise was ridiculous - a water running noise all day and night and thin walls make you hear every sneeze from adjacent rooms - and even knocks on other doors. The housekeeping staff and engineering staff was very friendly. Oh, and the TV is smaller than your computer screen. Unfortunately, be careful in the tub, its slippery and no grip mat.

Reviews.Title: “A bit dull and not great value”
Reviews.Author: alan070
Reviews.Content: Very good staff. Thankfully got an upgrade to a suite which was the size of a normal room with slightly noisy plumbing. To be fair it is an old building. Quite expensive for what you get. Restaurant and bar good and buzzy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for walking”
Reviews.Author: PDXWalker
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers a great location for those interested in going car-less. Inexpensive transportation is easy with buses to popular locations (airport, Balboa Park, ocean beaches and other "tourist attractions") are within a block, the trolley within 2 blocks and the Amtrak station within about 4 blocks. It is a pleasant, safe walk to the harbor and the Gaslamp district. I don't think I would stay at this hotel if I had energetic, school-age kids, as the room seemed small and there wasn't a pool or game room or such. On the other hand, that also could be seen as a benefit... :--) The check-in staff were friendly, the "tour desk" folks were really helpful, and we really enjoyed a Saturday freebie tour of the Gaslamp district (offered by the hotel). We appreciated being supplied with bottled water every day. The only downsides were intermittent TV reception and small, non-ADA bathrooms. I don't know if the hotel offers ADA-accessible rooms, but if this is something you need, you would be wise to inquire about it before making a reservation. The hotel has been tastefully restored, with interesting historical sconces in the hallways. Sometimes it is fun to stay in a place that ISN'T a national, mega-hotel chain. We reserved the hotel as part of an online travel package, getting really good room rates. Additionally, we were upgraded when we checked in, which was a nice touch as well. I would stay here again and also recommend it to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Sleek and Stylish w/ Thin Walls”
Reviews.Author: Landon D
Reviews.Content: The Sofia is truly deserving of 3.5 stars, but alas...that's not an option. Overall its a great hotel in a decent--not perfect--location. This historic hotel was renovated about 6 years ago and is roughly 4 blocks from where all of the downtown San Diego action begins. My room was petite, but packed with great modern amenities and a sleek decor. For the price I paid ($100), I couldn't have been happier... almost! On first glance, I thought the hotel deserved a solid 4 stars, but come 3a.m. I had the impression that I was back in a fraternity house--a room over, someone was enjoying a sensual moment and the walls are THIN. However, the late night escapades weren't my only noise issue. By 8a.m. it felt like the hotels housekeeping team (they were excellent by the way) was strategizing which room to clean next from the foot of my bed. Another concern, the shower! The rooms should come with "slippery when wet" signs. Although nicely tiled, the shower didn't have a door to prevent water from spilling on the bathroom floor. So, post scrub down, you best watch your step! Overall, the photo's on tripadvisor and on The Sofia's webpage are fairly accurate in terms of what you see is what you get. I enjoyed my visit and for the price would probably stay again. Beware though, there is a $9 nightly resort fee and overnight parking is $30... my $100 a night quickly became $140.

Reviews.Title: “Do not reserve on the hotel website”
Reviews.Author: johnbachel
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation on the hotel website. Because I needed to cancel I went back to the website, but found that it is not possible to do so there. I then called and cancelled. I asked for an email confirmation of the cancellation and was told that they could not provide one. When I asked for a confirmation number for the cancellation I was given the same number as the original reservation number. I called back again, since I had still had no proof of cancellation, and was told by a reservation agent that he would email a cancellation confirmation. When I did not receive one after six hours, I called again. This time I was again told that a cancellation confirmation could not be emailed, but I was offered a cancellation number over the phone. The cancellation number provided this time was different from the original reservation number. At this point, I still do not have a document provided directly by the hotel confirming that I did cancel my reservation. Because of the poor, inconsistent customer service that I received in trying to deal with my reservation cancellation, I cannot recommend that users reserve the Sofia Hotel on its website.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel with amazing service.”
Reviews.Author: NolaTraveler2012
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofia during a conference in San Diego. The conference was at the convention center, which is an easy five block walk from the Sofia. (The weather is so nice you want to walk anyway). The hotel lobby is very nice and modern, and they have plenty of counters to check-in. Our room was on the 5th floor, and was very clean and modern. The room is small, but uses the space very efficiently. Other than the shower stall glass, we really loved the room. The shower stall glass is a little on the short side, so water does tend to get all over the bathroom floor. The staff was friendly, prompt, and knowledgeable. The safe in our room was locked when we arrived. With one quick call down to the desk, the maintenance man had it open. We also forgot toothpaste, which they quickly provided. The concierge was very helpful with information about the area. All in all, a really beautiful boutique hotel, and we will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent x 3 plus pet friendly”
Reviews.Author: mardel65
Reviews.Content: The Sofia Hotel = Excellent: location, rooms and staff. The location was great, lots of restaurants and night life. The rooms are very modern and comfortable even though they are not very big they are well designed. The staff was very welcoming and helpful. The hotels offers a city walking tour to their guests that lasts about 1 1/2 hour. Our stay at this hotel was not very long but we are definetly returning. We did notice that the hotel allows pets.

Reviews.Title: “Ideally located, affordable & attractive downtown San Diego Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bahstar1
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant stay at the Sofia Hotel in San Diego. Despite confusion at the front desk over a living-social deal where we purchased a suite but the hotel initially checked us into a regular room, the Sofia Hotel is a terrific and centrally located near 4 star hotel in sunny San Diego. Since we were incorrectly checked into a regular king size room, we were able to view both the standard accommodations, as well as the reg suite. The standard room was small, but very charming. The Sofia is a historic, older hotel, and the room's character reflects this history: smaller sq. footage, high ceilings, various unique floor plans, not the cookie cutter layout of some newer hotel buildings. Staying as a couple in the standard room may present a challenge to some. So to avoid feeling cramped, I suggest paying more and staying in one of the suites. The suites are much more spacious. Granted these rooms may not be as large as 5 star, luxury locales, but nonetheless, the suites at the Sofia are terrific. With the sunny and window-abundant front parlor, connected to a private cozy bedroom, the suites at the Sofia provide comfortable, home-like retreats for the traveler visiting downtown SD. And the bathroom's original layout was cute and comfortable, most likely very similar to its original early nineteenth century design. There are various restaurants/cafes nearby (a chipotle, coffee bean & tea leaf to name a few), including the terrific and beautifully adorned Currant brasserie attached to the hotel, with its checkered tile floors, and flying buttresses that bridge the pillars and columns high above. All in all, the Sofia Hotel is a near 4-star, convientally located and peaceful retreat, within the vibrant and colorful downtown San Diego scene. (And I don't know what a certain trip advisor reviewer was talking about when he or she remarked that the neighbor surrounding the hotel was "seedy". Have you been to downtown LA or SF? I was impressed at San Diego's clean, near litter free streets, and only saw 2, maybe 3, homeless individuals.)

Reviews.Title: “Cute & Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Rachel D
Reviews.Content: I live in North County but when I am going out downtown I stay at the Sophia. It is a restored old brick building and they did a beautiful job! The rooms are tiny but they are newly updated and are nice. They are also pet friendly. The location is great too! RA sushi is right there..there is a yard house..you are right in the mix down town. There are a lot of bums around but thats down town SD in general. The price is fair too. I am glad I found this hotel. I also find good deals through expedia for the sophia.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but poor response to dangerous condition”
Reviews.Author: jasonjarvis
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with a good location for the convention center (and the restaurant on the floor level is great). Trendy and decent rooms with good value. But when my wife told the management that there was broken glass on the floor in the bathroom of the room (and indeed, a note from a prior guest saying so!), they did not respond with aplomb and three hours later after returning from dinner, the glass was still on the floor. Had to put down towels to walk around as the hotel was fully booked. There's a lot of cleanliness issues one can tolerate at a non-five star hotel. Broken glass in the bathroom isn't one of them.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent small hotel”
Reviews.Author: LDboy
Reviews.Content: Excellent and reasonably priced boutique hotel in downtown San Diego. Classy renovation of an older property with wonderful staff. Some reviewers complained about small rooms - wasn't such a problem for us except for two things: the reading chair was a bit in the way and to open the safe door you needed to shift furniture, so the only reason I didn't give it an additional star.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay in downtown”
Reviews.Author: Pras499
Reviews.Content: Was here for derm conference. Good stay with nice amenities and fair price. Good valet and courteous. Would recommend over W in Gaslamp.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Eric O
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very clean, had friendly staff, a good restaurant, and a coffee shop. The room was small but San Diego is all about being outside anyway. Other reviewers have whined about the size but I didn't find the size a problem at all. The location is great, it's a few blocks to the Gaslamp District and a short walk to the convention center. Short drive to all of SD's beaches and sights. It's not cheap but it's not too expensive either.

Reviews.Title: “Actually better than average...”
Reviews.Author: jbol
Reviews.Content: I would call the hotel good, not average. The rooms are nicely appointed and very clean, as was all the public areas. I give this a "good" rating primarily for the size of the rooms vs. cost of stay. The rooms are pretty small on the average (I've stayed here about 5-6 times) with even the suites being on the small side. Excellent location and the service has always been attentive when I've been here.

Reviews.Title: “Darling European like hotel”
Reviews.Author: comingtoyourcity
Reviews.Content: Botique hotel. I had a queen room and it was small but I didn't mind at all. There is a restaurant below that is great for dinner/drinks. It is not open for breakfast during the week, which was a bummer. Pros - modern room, great shower head, nice towels, fridge, microwave, new feeling rather than old and drab, free wifi, nice staff, allow dogs, easy to walk places (we walked everywhere), convenient location Cons - thin windows, walls and doors, slow small elevators, not the best lighting to put makeup on in the morning (a little dark) I would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Much better options a couple blocks in a better direction”
Reviews.Author: Jessica F
Reviews.Content: I love boutique hotels but not this one. I am from New York and have stayed in a number of small rooms, but this was RIDICULOUS!! I couldn't even open my suitcase all the way. The walls were painfully thin. I had good neighbors, but I could hear everything as if we were in the same room. Worse yet was the service. I dealt with the front desk 3 times and all 3 times were bad. Don't waste your money. There are better places, same price, and not next to the jail.

Reviews.Title: “Great overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: downey
Reviews.Content: Very easy check in, fast and pleasant. Got upgraded to a king bed even though we puchased this room on Priceline. Bed was very comfortable with nice linens and pillows. Upscale toiletries, and good quality towels. There is a decent safe, small fridge, microwave, and free wifi. The business centre is convenient and easy to print boarding passes. Rooms are nicely decorated. No bathtub, but shower was good. Very small TV for size of room. Parking is $30 per day! Overall I would definetly return as long as I wasn't driving.

Reviews.Title: “Very central, beautiful rooms”
Reviews.Author: O W
Reviews.Content: Very well positioned hotel. One can walk to the Gaslamp Qrt and to the Waterfront easily, nice comfortable rooms. However not so very good sound isolation. In addition there were roadworks the night we stayed and eventhough we were transferred to another side, we could still hear it. Price/Value (no breakfast, expensive parking) could be a bit better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Off2Vaca
Reviews.Content: We found the location to be great. Walking distance to the different areas of the city was doable for us. Our room was quite small and not very good use of the space. The bathroom had a pocket door and the sink (which was outside of the room) had no shelving and both areas were poorly lit (the shower was practically in the dark). The only mirror was behind the sink and that was hard to see. The bed was comfortable and for being on the 4th floor, the noise was relatively low. Reception was welcoming and noticed on weekends, the hotel has a special walking tour just for guests. For Happy Hour at Currant (which is everyday from 4-7 and then from 9-close) the prices were reasonable and drinks were great. Although the $30 per day fee for valet was a little steep, it was super easy and never had to wait for our car. Loved being able to text in advance that we needed the vehicle.

Reviews.Title: “I wanted to give it 4 stars, but...”
Reviews.Author: Stephis
Reviews.Content: Sofia Hotel, I had such high hopes for you... but you really disappointed me, and that really made me sad. I'm a traveler that prefers to stay at boutique hotels, and have always wanted to try the Sofia. It seems like a really cute and nice hotel, but my stay was just okay. Pros: Front desk staff was super friendly, as was the bell man. Barely even spoke to the valet guys, they were too busy chatting up the cute girls dressed up for Mardi Gras and we had to ask them to take our keys. Location, location, location... so close to the harbor, convention center, and gaslamp district... *some* of the amenities... yoga studio was nice, if it wasn't for the jackhammer and construction going on right outside. There is a small fitness area, but I have to admit I was taken with the yoga studio, if it wasn't for the noise. Wifi was "free" once you paid a $8/night fee for "amenities." I still don't understand that. Especially because I wasn't given an option, they just added this to the bill they have beach cruiser bikes for you to rent at no cost (probably included with the "amenities" charge... they were really nice bikes, and was an awesome way to get around the city for a few hours. CONS: Construction... LOUD construction outside the hotel... we woke up after Mardi Gras celebrations to a jackhammer (not the best way to wake up post Mardi Gras). Parking... $30!!!! I didn't see a sign for self park at the hotel. I probably wouldn't be as upset about the parking charge, but that valet was completely distracted the time we checked in and when we were leaving trying to retrieve our car. After texting the number they give you to have your car brought up, we still waited close to 20 minutes to have our car brought up. Room: SMALL! Super small. I know when you come to San Diego you aren't supposed to stay in your hotel room, things are just too beautiful in the city to miss, but when you have to move furniture in the room so that you can hang 2 dress shirts and a coat in the closet, there's something wrong with the situation. The view... what view?! our window faced a brick wall, no joke. We faced a brick wall and the window looking into another room. Summing things up: The Sofia has some potential, it's been around for about 5 years, but still don't have their act completely together. I really wanted to give this hotel a better rating, but just couldn't do it. I don't think I will return to the Sofia, even if it is for a night's stay.

Reviews.Title: “Thank God it was only one night!”
Reviews.Author: JulianNguyen
Reviews.Content: As I write this review, I am currently in my hotel room here at the Sofia hotel. The fact that I could not wait another second to write this review should show just how horrible and shady this place is. The Sofia hotel is something like a boutique hotel which has masked its lack of customer service and shady business ethics with decent lookin decor and overly scented rooms (probably to cover up some Sort of foul odor). As of February 20th, 2012 this hotel is basically right next to a construction site. If i were to look out the window, there is literally a guy with a jackhammer standing about 5 feet from me. It is definately not a great feeling to wake up after a night out in San Diego, to the sounds of what can only be described as a World War 2 reenactment at 9AM. What really turned me off was the fact that I (or anything of the 3 travelers I checked in with) , received no warning from ANY of the staff when we were checking in. When I notified the front desk, I was told that my complaint would be forwarded to management and that there was basically nothing they could do because I had already paid for the room. Basically..." we're take your complaint seriously but we already have your money so thanks for letting us know how you feel". Here's the kicker...this place is independently owned and operated! Which is probably one of the biggest reasons why i decided to stay here, thinking that there customer service would be unmatched. Don't be fooled though, the way my complaint was handled...the Sofia hotel might as well be another corporate machine. Also the rooms do appear to seem clean but my opinion was quickly changed when I found myself standing in a shower with a clogged drain. To sum it all up...I'm glad I'm getting out of this place.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy but small”
Reviews.Author: DebiLovestoTravel
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights here in a room with 2 double beds (three before our cruise and one day after). The rooms are very, very small but quite comfortable. We did not have space to open two suitcases at the same time. Sink is separate from toilet/shower. Nice shower, comfortable beds, nicely decorated. Well appointed with fridge, microwave, laptop safe, etc. The TV is a flat screen but small (maybe 18"). You can hear people talking in the hallways and door banging closed. Had to phone the desk to ask our neighbors to turn down their music and lower their voices as we were having trouble getting to sleep. A resort fee (about $8) is charged which gives you "free" wifi and 2 small bottles of water. Front desk staff and door man friendly. Note there is NO concierge and the doorman is nice but not all that knowledgeable. Housekeeping staff are not friendly nor do they say hello. Strong smell of bleach in showers. The hotel is well located only a short walk to the USS Midway and harbor and opposite direction to the Horton Plaza. About 5 blocks from the Gas Lamp area. On site restaurant is not open for breakfast during the week but there are other choices within blocks. The Transit Store is across the street so it is very easy to buy a transit pass (good for the bus and trolleys), obtain maps and route guides. The Westgate and Westin hotels are a block away. Our room would be fine for a single or couple but do not recommend it for families. Dod not try the yoga studio but a channel on TV runs a continuos yoga session which would be nice but our room was too small to try it. There is no other fitness facility.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay, eat, drink, play in Historic Downtown”
Reviews.Author: 2kitty2
Reviews.Content: Great location for gaslamp and horton plaza. The happy hour was wonderful and great place to eat and the drinks were really good. The bed is very comfortable and the room clean and upgraded. We will definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “historic downtown”
Reviews.Author: rcaulder1
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in this historic downtown hotel. The boutique room is small but has all the amenities you expect--coffee maker, microwave, refrigerator, iron. Even a laptop safe. The bathroom had only one overhead light--no light in the glass-enclosed shower. Showerhead is dead center above you with low water pressure. Bus stops are nearby, harbor, Gaslamp District, 5th avenue restaurants walking distance. Nice stay. Only drawback--we were hit with an amenities charge at check-out. Fee for wi-fi, coffee maker, microwave, refrig, etc. Kind of ridiculous.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: Deborah S
Reviews.Content: This was a beautiful hotel with a great location, only a few blocks from the Gaslamp District. Walking distance to lots of bars, nightclubs and restaurants. Also walking distant to the ocean and other main Downtown SD attractions. I loved that the hotel was pet friendly. Although our room was a bit small, it was fully equipped and decorated beautifully. I loved the old, industrial feel to the building. I would definitely come back. BTW, some other reviews were complaining about the Greyhound stop. Yes, it is right behind the hotel, and I'm sure it could get noisy. However, my room was on the opposite side so I did not hear any noises at night. Make sure you request a room facing the other street.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful heritage boutique hotel in great location.”
Reviews.Author: Jozcat
Reviews.Content: We did quite a bit of research before booking this hotel, I wanted to be downtown and was very happy to choose something warm and quaint with a personality rather than a more modern hotel chain. I was so happy that we chose The Sofia. The location was perfect - could walk everywhere we wanted to go including some lovely restaurants in the Gaslamp District. Close to really good public transport - we went to the zoo on the bus as well as back to the airport and also caught a bus over to Coronado. The hotel staff were really friendly and so helpful from the bellboys to the concierge, our room staff and especially the front desk. Yes, the room was quite compact! Good practice for our cruise a couple of days later! The bathroom was lovely, had all the amenities we needed and a lovely comfy bed. Good shopping mall just over the road, loved the photos and the history of the hotel. Would be very happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “central and convenient”
Reviews.Author: justchillin041
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the Sofia for 6 nights while exploring San Diego. it is a smaller little boutique-style hotel right down in the middle of the city. the desk staff and concierge were helpful and welcoming. it was easy to walk to the nearby shopping centre at Horton plaza, the Ralph's grocery another block further away and very central to the transit system which seems to work pretty well. there is no room service for food in the rooms or mini-bar, but if you want you can order a very nice dinner at the bar and take it to your room or eat it there in the bar/restaurant. i found the food, wine and room costs very affordable. the bar is intimate and relaxed, yet welcoming even for the single traveler. you can also stock up at Ralph's for nibblies and wine. there is a small fridge in each room. the rooms are kept clean and there is no shortage of towels. but the room i had was small, it was a bit snug....but i was offered another larger room for a bit more money. i did not move because i had already unpacked and settled in. the bed was comfortable. there was no view at all from my room, but it was fairly quiet on the 7th floor. the lobby was nicely appointed with internet service available. there is a spa, which i did not try...and an exercise room and free newspapers. also there is a nice touch for guests in the lobby where there is a large iced water dispenser for thirsty travelers, fresh with lemon slices. the concierges were very helpful to me. i got clear and easy instructions and directions from both of them. thanks! it was a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and good restaurant”
Reviews.Author: ELOISE R
Reviews.Content: I like it! I chose this hotel thanks the advices of tripadvisors people. I didn't look anything about this hotel in the internet. So I was very surprised to find out that it was "so elegant and warm" for the price. I booked for 3 nights and paid 360 $ excl. tax and excl. the 7$/day for amenities (obligatory). But it's ok if you think that in the list you get: 2 bottle of water (0.5 liter each) every day, free internet in the room, the use of computer in the lobby, ... There is also a SPA + fitness but I didn't have the time to check them. The room was also beautiful. I had room 519 with windows on two sides, in front of the bed and on the right side. Even if there were buildings in the front, I liked the room, because you can see the sun rising in the morning. ca. 15 minutes walk to Gaslamp with many many restaurants and bars. In the hotel there is the american bistro "Currant" -> very good and beautiful. It doesn't look like the typical restaurant of a hotel. The only bad thing: the valet/parking. 30$/day!!! Tip of San Diego: go to Hotel Coronado and watch the sunset :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great space in a small space”
Reviews.Author: MartyB12
Reviews.Content: The Sofia Hotel provides greatly appointed rooms, tastefully furnished in a small space. The hotel maximizes the space in each room by providing enough storage, work, and entertainment space. The bed was large and comfortable, and both my girlfriend and I slept fantastic. The hotel is located close to public transit which was great for getting to the many tourist attractions we visited. The Sofia is also close to many restaurants, and dining locations, the best being Currant located right in the hotel. I highly recommend The Sofia Hotel for any visitor to San Diego

Reviews.Title: “small, but clean and nice”
Reviews.Author: ean74
Reviews.Content: Very professional staff. Clean rooms, nicely decorated, small like a NYC hotel room. Not the most picturesque scenery outside but only a short walk to nicer area and gas lamp. Would stay here again. Well priced.

Reviews.Title: “Mute reception staff”
Reviews.Author: sekingrn
Reviews.Content: Great location! Close to everything in the Gaslamp. Great restaurant! However, front desk staff do not greet guests on arrival. They were mutes!!! Rooms have paper thin walks. Bathroom layout is wierd. Our sink was right inside the door to the room. Shower with only a 1/2 wall. Could hear trolley running a block behind the hotel. Lots of street noise. Valet blew out my stereo speakers (stereo was off when I left car with them) but I can't "prove it" so they will not repair.

Reviews.Title: “A safe bet in downtown SD”
Reviews.Author: Laralalaaa
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a couple of times and its best asset is the staff. They're always friendly and helpful. The rooms are small but to me they have a cozier feel to them, and they're decorated with good taste. I also like its location (close to a trolley stop: Civic Center) and that they frequently have promotions and discounts on rates.

Reviews.Title: “Our Favorite Place to Stay Downtown”
Reviews.Author: Garethmb
Reviews.Content: During our recent trip to San Diego, we got to experience one of downtown’s more unique hotels. From the moment we pulled up to the Sofia Hotel, where we were greeted curbside by a friendly valet, the charming mix of old and new was abundant. Born of a $16 million renovation of San Diego’s historic Pickwick Hotel, the Sofia Hotel has an exceptionally decorated lobby with classic, old world charm and a smartly-dressed staff who were pleasant, helpful and efficient. Check-in was very smooth and in no time we were settling into our room. The spacious room offered a living room complete with couch, chairs, desk, table, drawers, and a television. Efficiently designed and comfortably appointed with a chic tone, the luxuries were in the detail. Our suite had an updated, modern bathrooms with a unique layout in that the sink and counter were in the throughway to the bedroom, opposite a shower and toilet chamber enclosed by a space-saving sliding door. Fine linen, with plush pillows made for a comfortable night’s rest. Gilchrist & Soames spa products and toiletries made even quick showers a delightful experience. The suite also included a microwave and a miniature fridge that came in handy during our four-day stay. The bedroom also had a television as well as a safe for storage of valuables. While the TVs were a bit smaller then in some other hotels they offered a wide range of channels including both free and on-demand movie channels and local information channels. Dining options were abundant as not only did the hotel offer its own bar and restaurant, the Currant Brasserie, but there were numerous restaurants as well as shopping options within an easy walk of the hotel. The Currant has been rated the best French Bistro in town and each evening offers and amazing specialty popcorn. I had expected it to be simply new seasonings and was happy to experience, meat, cheese, and other delights when it arrived. The hotel also offers spa services and the 24-hour Harkishan Yoga Studio and Health Center provides yoga mats and surround sound system and an on-call yoga instructor is available. The pet-friendly hotel also partners with Dogs and the City to offer pet care services such as grooming or in-room pet sitting. I strongly suggest taking advantage of the local area station on the in room cable service as I learned about some great venues in the area as well as a famous pancake resturant which has garnered national praise. While parking downtown can be a bit of an issue the Sofia offers valet parking at $30 a day. The valet service was extremely efficient and helpful and a couple of times provided directions that were even better than our GPS could provide. There are also numerous lots in the surrounding blocks which offer numerous options for guests. The hotel charges a resort fee of $12.00 per day which includes complementary Internet access as well as other amenities such as bottled water. Since this was a working trip, I was extremely grateful to have reliable access to the Internet and a comfy room in which to unwind after an extremely long day in a city that offers countless activities. Sadly our time went by very quickly but we were given and very friendly and prompt check out, and the reception desk even offered us coupons to a local dining facility. From a great room and very friendly staff, we cannot wait for a return visit to this charming hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel stay EVER!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: euexplorer
Reviews.Content: I decided to treat myself to a 4 star after a 20 hour trip to San Diego. Most unfortunately I decided on the Sofia. I was stuck in this pokey little room. To give an idea I could not fully open the wardrobe because the locker was in the way. My view consisted of a wall 6 feet opposite my window so you can imagine the amount of natural light I got. However I am not picky and the only thing that really matters to me is the ability to get a good nights sleep. However this was impossible because of the noise coming from what I assume was the air conditioning. It felt like I was sleeping on an airport runway with all the noise. I could not manage 2 hours straight of sleep despite being completely exhausted. This horrific experience cost me 300 dollars for 2 nights. This hotel is a joke and an embarrassment to the beautiful city of San Diego and should be aovided at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: AK_foodie2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofia 4 nights in mid November for a conference. While the property is old, it has been remodeled and updated. All the staff we encountered from the valet to front desk were very friendly and helpful. The rooms are quite small but incredibly clean. Even with a good room lay out it was a tight fit for two people. The only major issue with the room was the shower setup - the shower does not have a proper door or curtain and water inevitably got all over the floor no matter how careful we were. I recommend asking for more than one bath mat to help keep the floor dry. Having a refrigerator in the room was also really nice.The restaurant/bar in the hotel was fantastic! In the afternoons it was quiet enough to work and in the evenings they have great food and drink deals for happy hour. Several reviewers mentioned problems with homeless individuals outside of the hotel but it was on par with other hotels in large cities. If you feel uncomfortable and are heading to Horton Plaza or the convention center take 1st street instead of 4th (less people begging; Horton Plaza: take a left at the Horton hotel entrance, Convention center: straight down). There is also a grocery store on 1st and several nice coffee shops. However, if you want more selection for restaurants fourth street south of Horton Plaza has an awesome selection.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in the Heart of San Diego”
Reviews.Author: cHris78654
Reviews.Content: I had to fly into San Diego to pick up a car that was in storage, so I wanted to stay somewhere that had ready access to restaurants and shopping. I managed to book this hotel at a discounted rate, perhaps because I was staying on a Sunday night, well away from a major holiday. I really had no idea what to expect; the pictures looked nice enough though some reviewers had complained that the rooms were too small. The hotel staff was kind enough to let me check in at noon, which was fantastic because I was pretty tired from my flight. Second, they upgraded me to a queen sized bed (I had booked a double) at no extra charge! Be advised that they charge a tourist tax of about $7, which probably isn't included in whatever you paid online (I found this annoying, but not a deal-breaker). The interior of the hotel is lovely. Although it doesn't look new, it's very well taken care of. The fireplace in the little lounge next to the lobby is a nice touch, especially in winter. I'd disagree with the reviewers who complained that the rooms were too small; they're somewhat bigger than you would find in a 4-star hotel in Central Europe. Granted, they may not be massive, sprawling affairs, but they're certainly big enough to be comfortable. The rooms are tastefully decorated, clean, and comfortable. My sole complaint was that the shower door design is strange, and leads to a wet bathroom floor (annoying, but nothing more). The location couldn't possibly be any better. You're a ten-minute walk from the waterfront, five minutes from a decent mall, and maybe fifteen minutes from the Gaslamp district. Plenty of dining and shopping options are at your fingertips, which makes this hotel a good choice if you don't have a car. The hotel has a restaurant and bar attached; I only stopped in for drinks (the bartender knew quite a bit about beer, and rightfully recommended the local brews). Bottom line: Clean, comfortable rooms, good location, polite staff, good price!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location!”
Reviews.Author: KhanArt
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for about 4 nights with my wife when she was attending a conference. This was a very nice and clean hotel. The staff was friendly and answered our many questions especially on how to get from place to place. The location of the hotel was great. We used public transportation to visit San Diego Zoo and Sea World. This hotel was also not too far from the beach and airport. The night life was great and many things to do (shop, eat, see). The hotel had a fitness center and business center so we had everything we needed. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: NeilfromWallsend
Reviews.Content: Hotel in fantastic location near the Harbour and the nightlife.Rooms were immaculate and staff were very professional - would deffo stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, accommodating, and historic”
Reviews.Author: G2inParadise
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofia Hotel in San Diego for a conference I was attending. It was quite convenient to the Conference Center, Gaslamp District, Shopping District, and taxis were very reasonable to Old Town, the San Diego Zoo, and the airport. The 'boutique hotel' feel made the historic nature of it charming if not a bit small and compact. The staff was very helpful and got us everything we needed easily and hospitably. Great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Small noisy room”
Reviews.Author: shamway
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit and will be my last. The room was much smaller this time, hardly room to move about. We were also at the back of the hotel and it was very noisy as it faces a 24hr fire and ambulance station. The bed was also supposed to be a queen but it was a very small queen (not sure a full size bed would have fitted in the room!). The restaurant however is fantastic and the highlight of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Iris_Hilo
Reviews.Content: The Sofia Hotel is elegant but there was no view from our room because it looked into the windows of the next wing, which was only yards away. The windows don't open and the room was small with the bathroom weirdly located just inside the door. However, the location was great for walking to the Gaslamp district and the harbor and the bed was very comfortable. The food at Croce's restaurant was fabulous and the serivce and entertainment was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay, convenient but shady location”
Reviews.Author: mzee569
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 3 nights and the room was nice and contemporary. The room seemed very clean. The staff was nice and it seemed as if the bar/restaurant was pretty hopping. It is located near the Gaslamp District and an easy walk to the Convention Center. I was told by many that if you are out at night to walk on the main roads (I was traveling alone). I was kind of surprised to see how many homeless people in the area. I would stay there again only if I was with someone else to walk around with at night

Reviews.Title: “Service!”
Reviews.Author: TESSIERedDeer
Reviews.Content: Our room was small, and it reminded us of a cruise ship cabin..... but it was big enough to have all the immenities we needed with the exception of a bathtub. The shower is perfectly nice, but I like a bath much more. Since this hotel is a very old building it had character and charm. The big reason for the high rating is the service, the staff, the price and the location. Its perfectly located to walk anywhere in the gaslamp area, we enjoyed every moment of our stay in this hotel. Every time we either called or approached a member of the staff they bent over backwards to ensure they could meet our needs. Top marks!

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel in downtown San Diego”
Reviews.Author: busanio
Reviews.Content: We ended up here because another hotel was a horrible experience. Staying at the Sofia helped us recover and relax. If you like to wander downtown San Diego, this hotel is in a great location, close to the Gaslamp Quarter, the Convention Center, the Harbor, and Seaport Village. You can catch an inexpensive bus to Balboa Park and the Zoo just across the street. The beds was extremely comfy. The rooms were a bit tiny and crowded with the bed and other furnishings but the atmosphere was plush, the decor luxurious. We liked all the photos of the old hotel and San Diego that were hung on the walls and in the staircases. The front desk even upgraded our room for a lower price after we told them of our bad stay elsewhere. The hotel staff were superb over the phone and in person. All in all, a very satisfying stay.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Atram A
Reviews.Content: great place to stay for business or for leisure. Will recommend it to my friends definitely.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice with an eye to details”
Reviews.Author: giovanp
Reviews.Content: Cons: - Not a great location. Not the best of neighborhoods. Far from the beach and the convention center - Tiny regular rooms. And I mean tiny ... Pros: - Great service. Very attentive and friendly - Beautifully furnished rooms with an eye to details. Have been to other so called "boutique" hotels and most of the times I found them lacking. Not the Sofia.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Monica1234
Reviews.Content: Very happy with my stay at the Sofia, clean, safe, and quite. I was on 4th floor and had no issue with noise at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Historic Hotel in the Heart of San Diego”
Reviews.Author: DiamondTrimOC
Reviews.Content: We went to San Diego to see the Spanish Masters exhibit at the San Diego Museum of Art, and decided to stay at the Sofia. What a great choice. Being familiar with San Diego you can't beat its proximity to the Gaslamp. The rooms were small but nicely furnished and very clean. In room coffee and flat panel TV's. The parking for the hotel is valet only, and you pay through the nose at $32 per day of parking. Try the hotel restaurant "Current" for awesome food and drinks. They serve absynthe and awesome sangria in the bar, and have a late night happy hour. Great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal for a Small Room”
Reviews.Author: James V
Reviews.Content: Hotel is a nicely renovated property right across the street from Horton Plaza (shopping mall) in the North Gaslamp entertainment area. The rooms are quite small, but appointed well, and plenty of room for one person. TV was very small as well, but you are not spending much time in the room anyway, are you? My rate of $107 for a Wednesday, was the cheapest by far vs. other hotels in the area. As a comparison, the Westin was probably $75 more and in the exact some location basically. Once really nice ammenity is that they have "free for guest" bikes avaiable to cruise around the town, which was fun. The hotel is right near the bus terminal but that did not bother me at all. I ate at the Yard House a few blocks up, but there are plenty of options in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant well sited accommodation.”
Reviews.Author: mcavty
Reviews.Content: Good position downtown close by waterfront attractions, mall, & interstate bus station. Room could be larger, tho' was just sufficient for our 2 night stay. Some front desk staff more helpful than others.

Reviews.Title: “Reno Done Right”
Reviews.Author: MoJoJane
Reviews.Content: Historic hotel with a 2006 nice renovation in great location. They explain the history on their website if you are interested: http://www.thesofiahotel.com/history.html The rooms are SMALL and we skipped the expensive valet parking but did like the hotel. We didn't opt for the city view so there was no point in opening the curtains but we don't tend to stay in our room a lot when traveling to a new city. There was a parking garage was under Horton Plaza off 1st Street just past F Street on the right. The man there was super nice & if you come in after "business hours" it only costs $10. You do have to pay each time you remove your car but if you plan it right you can save money vs the hotel valet prices. The hotel lobby was quiet and classy design. We didn't eat at the restaurant or bar but did appreciate that it was an option. We did frequent the Ralph's grocery store nearby and used the fridge in our room. We'd stay there again if we return to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Claustrophobic & Smelly”
Reviews.Author: rdkell
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night, in town for business. I was pretty underwhelmed. When I first checked in was given a room that was being cleaned when I got there. Had to go back downstairs for another room. The room was extremely small, enough that it felt uncomfortable to me. It had filthy windows, that were unable to open (I'll get back to that), and covered in some sort of wire mesh. My view was a brick wall and some AC units. The room also smelled bad. It was a slight odor but was also musty and humid. I would have changed rooms again, but I checked in early and they were full. I had to change into a suit for a meeting and couldn't wait for another room. That is why I noticed that I couldn't even crack my windows. The wi-fi was intolerably slow on my new Mac. The shower's glass partition is too small, so be prepared to clip around after you shower. Also there is no fan in the bathroom. The absolute worst part was a very uncomfortable bed that dipped into the middle. The pillows were at least 6 inches thick and hard as a rock. I tossed all night. I will be fair and list the positives. The location is good if you are walking to shopping or dining downtown (though it is next door to the greyhound station and seems to be a favorite hangout for the homeless). The staff at the front desk and valet were courteous and professional. I had no issues with the people. The hotel's restaurant was surprisingly very good. It was busy and energetic and looked to have a mix of locals and guests. I would eat there again, but I would not stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay down town”
Reviews.Author: oodee
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sofia for a girls weekend. Really cute hotel, super friendly staff. The rooms were small but perfect for 2 friends for a weekend. Shower was strange with no shower door, just half glass, so water spray was hitting my feet when I turned it on. It was still a nice shower, just unusual. The location was perfect. Walked to a show and out to the gas lamp area. Great location for walking day or night. Parking at the hotel is exspensive so we parked in old town (free) and caught the trolly into town. Stops one block away from hotel. So many great restruants and things to do. I'll be coming back again.

Reviews.Title: “Very charming!”
Reviews.Author: californiawanderone
Reviews.Content: The Sofia Hotel is quite charming and in a great location. We were looking for a smaller hotel with a central downtown location and we could not have been happier. The Sofia Hotel is walking distance to the Gas Lamp District, Horton Plaza, Broadway Pier (ferry to Coronado for lunch!) and a trolley station. Really, does it get any better? We stayed in a suite and enjoyed the living area which had ample windows to let the light in. The bedroom was quiet and dark and perfect for naps. They have bicycles available which we used to go to the farmer's market in Little Italy. The employees were helpful and friendly. The Sofia Hotel was great and we can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, decent value”
Reviews.Author: MCrabtree
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean, modern, and is in a great location. The rooms were smaller than I was hoping for, and the view was pretty terrible (we overlooked the Greyhound station loading zone). The front desk staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The hotel offers bike rental, guided tours, and a fantastic restaurant with great happy hour and brunch specials. Overall, we were happy with our stay. While it was a bit overpriced, I would consider staying here again if we return to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Oracai
Reviews.Content: The price was great, as was the location. The staff was very friendly. A few reasons that I only give it 3 stars: the rooms are small and european style, the rooms lack a secondary security latch (standard at all hotels now), and the concierge were not the most knowledgable though the were very friendly and tried hard. Overall the location was great and the price reflected the short comings. The lack of security bolt would cause me not to stay there again though.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but valet parking can be avoided”
Reviews.Author: dinkybluebug
Reviews.Content: We liked staying here. It has a good location, about a 5 minute walk from the gas lamp quarter. We were a little surprised bt the $7.50 service fee that is mandatory and is paid per room per day. We were advised this on checkin to the hotel - and this fee included a few services such as wifi, two free bottles of water per day and the use of the some bikes if we wanted. We didnt mind so much in paying this, but if it is non negotiable, I felt it should be included in the room fees. Irrespective of this, we did use the wifi in our room and was pleased that it worked in all locations of the hotel, not just the lobby. The parking at the hotel is £30 per overnight stay. It is valet parking only - there isn't a self park option. From reading other posts on tripadvisor, everyone said that the valet parking is the only viable option. This isn't true, we parked our car in the Public multi-story carpark on columbus street. (see http://g.co/maps/jxwj4) - this was 3 blocks away - 1098 Columbia street - took less than 5 minutes to walk there from the hotel and only cost $15 per overnight stay (in after noon, out before noon the next day) We would stay here again - but dont be fooled into using the hotel valet parking - there are other options available. The car park can be found here -

Reviews.Title: “OK. But you could likely do better”
Reviews.Author: elizab54
Reviews.Content: We checked into the hotel last weekend for a wedding. The wedding rate was $130/night, significantly less than the advertised rate on the website for bookings during the same weekend. And thank goodness: I may have been angry if I'd had to pay more. The hotel staff was pleasant overall. However, the rooms are super small. Like: NYC or European-hotel-room-small. I actually had 2 nights of unpleasant sleep for a few reasons. First, I could hear people outside in the hallways throughout the night. I'd characterize the hotel guests as relatively young overall so there were people who were heading out for the night and yelling about taking shots when we were trying to fall asleep. (I probably should've asked them for a shot, it could have helped me sleep.) Second, the hotel is located next to or near a fire station so you can hear the sirens of the fire trucks when they're called out in the night. Third, I found I could hear the guests in the room next door in the morning when they were speaking to one another. Not ideal. My final issue was the silly shower situation: yes it's a lovely shower with pretty tile, great water pressure and plenty of hot water. But I have a feeling the folks who designed the shower stalls decided to keep the shower space open (the glass doesn't fully enclose the shower) for aesthetic reasons and to make the space seem larger. However, it simply succeeds in getting water on the floor. Not a huge deal but something that could be viewed as a bit annoying. On the positive side: great location!

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, cold staff.”
Reviews.Author: CTFoster
Reviews.Content: I'm quite surprised at the "good" reviews. The chicken wire on the windows is quite uninviting. We were on our honeymoon, and the room, while nice, was over-priced and small. We checked out early and went to another hotel. The front desk did not care enough to ask why or to ask if there was anything they could do. When asking about attractions or restaurants, they simply gave us a map. What happened to employees who actually care about their jobs? What happened to hotels that actually care about their guest and the experience? The gentlemen running the valet were the friendliest and most helpful. They should be commended.

Reviews.Title: “"Wonderful romantic experience with my husband... We couldn't have been happier!"”
Reviews.Author: J4sing
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went for a quick weekend trip for his birthday and found Hotel Sofia online. I had seen some "iffy" reviews online so I was a little worried, by as soon as I was greeted by the staff when we walked I the door I felt like royalty. Even though I accidentally booked the wrong night online, the staff was so helpful. Not only did they give us an upgrade in a better room, but it ended up being cheaper than my original booking price. We then went in our room and it was just beautiful! Down feather comforters and pillows on the beds, a beautiful view of the city, and soft large towels for the shower!! Not only did we have a romantic stay, but included in our room was free bike rentals. We took a little stroll to Little Italy and down the coast and had an amazing first trip to San Diego. Thank-you hotel Sofia for the incredible rate for such a luxurious experience! Oh and a shout out to the Valet-man Austin and front-desk man Brian!! You guys made our trip more special than I could have imagined!!

Reviews.Title: “Would do it agian”
Reviews.Author: J T
Reviews.Content: A hidden gem, reminds of the 40's,50's coustomer service. Quaint little place. Brian was wonderful & place is centrally located. Restaurant has a very simple but excellent brunch. Service very quick. Would stay agian. Bit small but beautiful clean rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!!!”
Reviews.Author: pariscoco9
Reviews.Content: The Sofia Hotel is a must. Close to shopping, bars, restuarants. The staff are very friendly. Hotel room was very clean and very comfortable. The hotel offers free wifi and also provides bikes for free if you feel like going for a bike ride. Hotel is pet friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms but pretty good”
Reviews.Author: ellie1983
Reviews.Content: Good location about 5 mins from the gaslamp and close to the harbour. The only problem with the location is the close proximity of the greyhound bus terminal, which can have some slightly sketchy looking characters hanging around. The hotel itself is clean and modern, with a decent gym. All nicely decorated too. The only problem is that the rooms are really, really small. As a result, the bathroom layout is a bit odd - our sink was in the room just by the door and then toilet and shower in the bathroom. Overall, a good hotel as long as you get a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “just OK”
Reviews.Author: LiliKB
Reviews.Content: I was in San Diego for work, and my husband came to visit. It was a tight squeeze for us, and our luggage. Very much like a european hotel. It's nicely decorated, and modern, but doesn't seem to use the small space efficiently in the choice of furniture or layout. The shower has no door, and there was no way to direct the water flow from the shower head, so every time we showered, the bathroom had a puddle of water. The air conditioner was also so loud, that I had to turn it off to sleep. The walls were very thin, and I could hear my neighbor's alarm clock go off in the morning! Another concern is that it's located right next to the Greyhound Bus station-not so keen on that, as I work nights, and often walked home by myself. Proximity to dining, and entertainment was good. I was there for two weeks. I would only stay there again for a short stay, and I got a good room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Getaway haven”
Reviews.Author: blgrn8
Reviews.Content: I booked from the hotel's website for one night and got a 25% discount. I requested early check-in since I was arriving by train, four blocks away from the Santa Fe Depot. The hotel honored the early time which I was grateful for. When I walked in my room, it was cozy and welcoming and just the right size for my own sense of privacy and comfort. I rested for about a couple of hours before heading out to the city by foot. I walked through the Horton Plaza Mall after a late lunch in a nearby quiet Thai restaurant. I mostly spent my time in The Gaslamp Quarter and Seaport Village, guided by a Downtown map provided to me at check-in. My room was a deluxe queen on the third floor, a few steps from the elevator and stair case. I didn't have much of a view from the window which was fine since I requested a quiet room away from the street. I enjoyed the room amenities, lighting, air conditioning, and furnishings, but most of all, the comfortable bed and plush pillows. The only thing odd was a half glass enclosure for the shower stall (see photos of the other reviewers). I had a towel on the floor for the excess water/splash and I wore my own flip flops so not really a big deal. Just a different set up. I liked the water pressure and temperature control. When I got ice from the machine on the second floor, I took some time to read the historic information about the hotel on the light scones in the hallway. Part of my reason for choosing to stay at The Sofia Hotel is its history. Since I only stayed for one night, I really didn't familiarize myself with the hotel's services as advertised on their website. Perhaps next time. I could go back to San Diego JUST to stay at The Sofia. I had a relaxing time and would try to book for more than one night next time!

Reviews.Title: “Looked great in photos. Nicely decorated, but rooms a bit small. Worth the money.”
Reviews.Author: Outofdodge_10
Reviews.Content: The rooms felt a bit small. The valet was excellent. They were very quick w/the car being brought in and out of the garage. Extremely nice and polite. The staff was fine. The rooms were cleaned without disturbance. I felt a bit claustrophobic in the rooms, but they were very nicely decorated and comfortable. The pillows weren't great, so I didn't even use one. No real criticism other than the room size. It is worth the money because this hotel is in a great spot and it isn't pricey at all. Also, internet was free...very refreshing! I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Busy downtown area”
Reviews.Author: grt_8woman
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night. Smallest room ever stayed in. Watch out for all the extras, (typical for downtown hotel locations), such as $30 a day parking, extra $8.00 per day for 'convienience' charge. Probably wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Small but clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: MatiraSunset
Reviews.Content: Overall I liked this hotel. We got a decent nightly rate and were close to the Gaslamp District. The rooms were very small, but the decor was nice and the beds were comfortable and clean. Overall I would recommend this place I'd you get a deal like we did. Hotels for less than $200 per night are a find! Hightlights were the Currant Restaurant food/happy hours, location, and comfortable beds. Lowlights were small rooms (small shower) and parking ($30/night and you cannot easily access your car unless valet brings it out for you).

Reviews.Title: “OOOH WOW !!! ONLY THE BEST”
Reviews.Author: wanderlust1979
Reviews.Content: GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE GOES A LONG WAY... From valet service, to front desk, to housekeeping, to forgotten item. Valet service was very prompt and they were so nice, our car was always right there when we are getting ready to leave, never had to wait. Front desk Brian was just so helpful. I knew my way around SD since I lived here for 2 yrs but after my husband and I checked-in, he immediately took out the map and gave us all these helpful locations to visit. Thanks Brian!!! As we walked down the hallways to our room, housekeeping was making her way to another room and she immediately moved her cart & she stood on the side to make way for us to walk. I was amazed!!! Usually they would just pass us by and wont even stop but she made sure she stopped and let us pass first then she continued on her way. Awesome! Hubby forgot his shoes after we had already checked-out. He remembered 3 hours later so we called to ask if they can check. We didnt receive a call back so 3 days later I called to inquire and was told they would check. Tyler called back within 5 mins and said housekeeping kept it for us. Since we had already left the area and the hotel never called us back when we were still in town, they shipped the items to us. They waived the hotel fee for shipping since they forgot to call us when we first called for the item. IF I can give this hotel a 10 star, I would. Not only staff was the best, location was just perfect. Easy to find. Great room.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Boutique Hotel in Downtown San Diego”
Reviews.Author: asdavis
Reviews.Content: The Sofia Hotel is a great boutique hotel located in Downtown San Diego. While the rooms are small, they are charming, clean and comfortable (great beds!). The hotel has a great location, and is walking distance from the Gaslamp District, the Convention Center, and Sea Port Village. You are also a short drive from Hill Crest, Little Italy and North Park-- vibrant local neighborhoods.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to unwind after San Diego Freeways!”
Reviews.Author: xntric
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Sofia on a quick overnight trip to visit the Zoo. I don't like "downtown" areas, generally, but once you enter this calm and lovely boutique hotel, you'll feel like you could be just about anywhere. The staff was exceptionally warm and welcoming, offering us a very reasonable upgrade to a larger suite, which we opted for. The rooms are on the small side, but classic, clean and cozy, especially for a short stay. Make sure to take a self-guided "historical" tour with the help of the hallways and their dreamy, fact & image-filled lithophane light sconces! Not wanting to revisit the bustling streets at dinner time, we decided to try our luck at the hotel's restaurant, CURRANT. Delicious. Perfect choice for two hungry foodies! The pre-dinner Sangria was exceptional. Our waiter was exceptional, too. It was an easy drive from there to the zoo.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NYKman
Reviews.Content: The Sofia hotel, San Diego, CA. is a very nice hotel. Dispite the small size of the room it was decorated very nicely and the space was utilized perfectly. There is a microfridge and intenet. They do charge an $8.50 fee however. The lobby is excellent with modern decor. The one big drawback is the homelessness in the area near the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lillau81
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean and staff friendly. They had a useful computer room where you could use the computer for free and even print! The rooms and ensute bathroom were a bit small, but clean and comfortable. It's true what the other reviewers say, you have to becareful with the shower as it floods the bathroom floor, and there isn't anything you can do to prevent it. The hotel is in a great location, walking distance from all the nightlife, restaurants and shopping. Easy road access to drive around San Diego. Great stay, I would stay there again,

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel with fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: rato
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Sofia hotel for two nights after a business trip for which I stayed elsewhere. Before staying there, I had dinner at the restuarnat on the ground floor: the food was really good and the decor made it a very pleasant evening. The members of staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was beautifully decorated - I can still remember the comfort of the arm chair! There's also a business centre with three computers and one printer. The location of the hotel superb - walking distance to Glaslamp, bus and tram stops. if I happen to go to San Diego again, the Sofia hotel will be my first choice!

Reviews.Title: “A great example of design and comfort - a wonderful boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: chickenoregg
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sophia Hotel during Comic Con, probably the most nightmarish situation for a hotel, big or small. While the cleaning staff seemed overwhelmed (three bottles of mouthwash, no shampoos? Four towels, one facecloth?) these points were minor and didn't affect my comfort. I had been told the rooms were small but you wouldn't know it - my room had a king bed, a writing desk, a comfortable sitting char, a closet, a service area with a coffee maker, mini fridge and microwave as well as glasses and botles of wine for purchase and complimentary water bottles. I enjoyed visiting the fitness center (complete with lemon infused water) and the 24 hour yoga studio. The staff was super friendly and incredibly helpful answering any question and providing for any need. And, Current, the hotel's bistro, is a must visit,! Try the Crispy Ham and Cheese...this dish was perfect. So were the lemon drop martinis. I look forward to experiencing this hotel during a visit to San Diego that will be "just for fun."

Reviews.Title: “well priced and clean”
Reviews.Author: bretthyslop
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated near centrally between the water and the gas quarter, It is clean and well priced. Will stay again next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot but neighborhood itself a little dicey”
Reviews.Author: WashDCTravelGuy
Reviews.Content: The Sofia was a great spot to be headquartered out of for our trip to San Diego. We were able to walk to the Gaslamp District, Petco Park, and the ferry to Coronado Island from here. Balboa Park (the zoo etc.) and the North Park neighborhood are just a short cab ride away. The Sofia isn't far from city hall, city jail, and is immediately next door to the Greyhound station so if that is an issue for you avoid it. But, we found that it was a great place for us. The room was very nice--comfortable beds and totally functional. It was a little small, but that's not a problem. The sink area was outside of the main bathroom, but that's not uncommon in hotel rooms and didn't bother either of us. The shower was nice, but there is no shower door--just a wall of glass that ends about halfway down the shower. It ended up getting a little bit of water outside the shower but that wasn't too big an issue. There is an extra roughly $8 daily service fee, but Internet is included in that, so I thought it was actually a net win. You also get two bottles of water, which is nice if your going to be wandering around the city all day. The business center is open 24/7 and includes free printing for those boarding passes to get home.

Reviews.Title: “Queen Studio Suite was a wonderful room”
Reviews.Author: youngcouple40
Reviews.Content: I had stayed here before 2 years ago and was quite pleased. Therefore, I booked it for our 4th of July weekend getaway. My husband admitted that he was a little leary about the hotel before seeing it, thinking it would be a hotel comparable to the Best Western or Holiday Inn category of hotel. However, he was very happy upon arriving. With the quickness and politeness of the valet staff, the convenient and secure parking location, the professional front desk staff, to the attached restaurant and modern atmosphere of the lobby, he was very impressed. Once we entered our Deluxe queen suite, he was even happier. We both enjoyed the brightness of the room with all the windows, the extra room to spread out, and the modern touches. There were many storage options and plenty of space for suitcases. The bed was comfortable with soft sheets, and the rooms had shades and curtains for darkness at night. The thermostat was always set correctly. the rate was excellent, and the guest service fee per night was well worth it. It includes the business center, internet access in the room, bottled waters each day, bikes available, a workout room and yoga room and newspapers in the lobby. We enjoyed having the 2 bottled waters for on the go everyday, (there is a refrigerator in the room as well), the internet access in the room, and mostly the use of the bikes. You have to get downstairs early to reserve them. My husband spoke to the concierge a few times, and they gave him helpful information. One of the valet guys even ran at Terminator speed and got us something we needed out of the car one day. I can't think of anything I would change about my experience at the Sofia Hotel. it was perfect. I highly recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Worth a little extra money to stay here”
Reviews.Author: laliz5
Reviews.Content: I was looking to book a hotel for 2 nights in San Diego, and nearly booked at a cheaper hotel to save some money. After reading the reviews for that hotel I decided I wanted to spend a little more and get something nicer for my money, so I booked at Sofia. I'm glad I did. It is a well-maintained hotel with modern and nicely decorated guest rooms. The location is GREAT, we didn't have to drive anywhere all weekend because you can get there on foot. The parking fee is the biggest negative at this hotel though. For a 2 night stay you'll end up spending an extra $70+ on parking for 2 nights plus the resort fee. Besides that extra money, I'm still happy I booked at Sofia - it was worth spending a little more for a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Sofia is a good bet”
Reviews.Author: gmartmorehotel
Reviews.Content: Sofia Hotel is in a good location if you are looking to be downtown, and withing walking distance of many San Diego hot spots. Just two blocks from Horton Plaza, the GasLamp, and about 5 blocks or so from Seaport Village. Downtown isn't as nice as some other areas, so expect it to be a bit grittier than other parts of the city. The hotel itself has a great facade, with valet attendents readily available at all hours. We called for our car several times, and never had to wait more than five minutes. All of the staff we encountered were professional, and the room was very clean and well appointed. We had a corner suite, which was more than ample. Sofia is a real value, and we would certainly go back if the occasion called for it.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel....”
Reviews.Author: DAB_LMB
Reviews.Content: I was attending an international conference and left booking the hotel so late that the conference hotel and all other hotels near the convention centre were all booked out; including all the brand/flag hotels that we are familiar with. We weren't disappointed by this hotel although I had a few hesitations not knowing it. I did check Trip Advisor for reviews and they were all good. We arrived early due to our flight being a morning flight and we thought we would have to leave our luggage and come back. The front desk staff was so friendly and welcoming. Once they looked at our reservation the person commented that we were staying for 5 days and said for a visitor staying 5 days they couldn't keep us waiting and would see what they could do. We were upgraded to a lovely suite which was great especially with the length of time we were staying. The location is within walking distance of everything and the staff is very helpful. There may not be the amenities - pool etc but the hotel is great and so is the lovely bistro/restaurant and bar. Definitely would recommend to anyone staying in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Sofia Hotel: more than the sum of its parts”
Reviews.Author: rnginpa
Reviews.Content: I like the Sofia Hotel. It's away from the hubbub of the convention center (where you invariably run into someone after convention hours) has been nicely refurbished in a sort of contemporary Art Deco style, has a friendly, courteous staff (except for one guy, Kleeber, who ought to be in the backroom and NOT dealing with customers). The rooms are small. After all, it's a hotel built in, what, the 1930s? But they make optimal use of the layout using sliding doors and compact cabinets. As with everyone else, I think $30 is a lot to pay for parking...and then I think of how much it is to park in downtown San Francisco...and then I shrug my shoulders. So I figure, we are in downtown San Diego. The valets are VERY helpful. I needed stuff form my car several times the first day and they were cheerful and prompt. I wasn't crazy about the food at the Currant restaurant but that may be because I'm not a fan of sauces on my food: the savory sauce on my calamari obscured the taste of the calamari, which is what I wanted to taste. The steak sandwich had a bernaise-like sauce (I think) that hid the essence of the steak. But that's more personal preference on my part. Kleeber...such a dude, especially when compared to the service orientation of his colleagues (like Assistant Manager McClain, Brian and the concierge, whose name I've forgotten). I woke up at 4:30 am the first day, found that I forgot my razor. I went downstairs to ask for one. Two desk people were there. Kleeber, who was looking at his screen (and never looked up)and another desk person, who was helping two people. It was ONLY when the busy desk person asked Kleeber to help me that Kleeber looked up from his screen. (Yep, Kleeber, can't lose those google searches or whatever you were looking at on the screen, even when you are on the clock, huh?) I asked Kleeber for a razor. He looked, then said they ran out. I asked him what I could do. He said I could go to the 7-11 and buy one. That's when I looked at his name badge, said it aloud and started walking away. Then, knowing I was annoyed, he said that they could go to the 7-11 and get one for me. I replied saying that that was a good answer since the hotel info binder said they had spare razors and such for forgetful people like me. (Turns out the 7-11 didn't sell them, so management sure has to get some spares in.) I don't fault the desk people for no having a razor available. That's management's job. But someone with Kleeber's service attitude really should not be dealing with the paying public. I'll surely stay at the Sofia the next time I am in San Diego but I'll do two things: be sure I have a razor and, if Kleeber is still on the desk, wait for someone else to help me. Surely, he won't help anyone that he interacts with.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service and rates - very small rooms and beds”
Reviews.Author: blindlemonpie
Reviews.Content: So whats good about this hotel, i) it's downtown and very close to the Gaslamp District (5 mins walk), also only 10 mins walk from the waterside, ii) good service (complimentary drink at the bar, free access to bikes for guests, a walking tour service etc, iii) great rates, we paid $101 a night. My only moan is the size of the room. It was tiny and that wouldn't be so bad if they'd forced a queen bed into the room but we only had a double and didn't sleep well as a result (and we aren't "big" people).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: keffo
Reviews.Content: The rooms at the Sofia Hotel are very small but there is an excellent use of space involved so that the size of the room does not matter. Besides, because of location you would be crazy to spend all your time in your room. The Hotel is three blocks from the trolley station, a few blocks from the Gaslamp district, a 15-20 minute walk or 10 minute trolley ride from Petco Park. There are also good bus lines on Broadway St. Best of all the Hotel has bikes for the asking so for two days my partner and I biked all over SD even as far as Ocean Beach. The staff was friendly and informative. We did not spend any time in the bar or restaurant but that was only because there was so much to do in SD. We had a deal through Travelocity and it was well worth it. Thumbs up for the Sofia Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Shoebox sized room; mandatory daily service charge; sketchy location”
Reviews.Author: PQD1965
Reviews.Content: Overall this place felt clean but the room was the size of a shoebox, the toilet seat looked ancient and was "well worn", and the streets nearby were not so nice. I would definitely try my luck at a different hotel next time I'm in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, so-so location, dinged heavily for extras”
Reviews.Author: Soulsurfer3
Reviews.Content: Overall, the hotel is a good clean hotel. Rooms are a bit on the small side, but are clean and modern. The location is so-so. Close to downtown and the gaslamp, the immediate neighborhood has nothing close by except the greyhound bus station. What was surprising was how many extra charges I incurred. I brought my dog which is great that they allow dogs, but for $25/day! All that got was some free biscuits. Parking is $30/day, which I can understand if the hotel were downtown or by the gaslamp, but surprising when you're in a transition neighborhood. On top of that there's a resort fee ($10/day). So all in, I was billed $65/day extra in fees.

Reviews.Title: “Extorted out of $18”
Reviews.Author: travelerbiz
Reviews.Content: This hotel claims to have wifi that they force you to purchase, but then when you log on to use it the connection is to weak to maintain connectivity. I asked for a refund of the BS resort fee and they said it was for other services which I was not using. Can you say bait and switch. Not to mention the rooms are smaller than a shoe box. STAY SOME WHERE ELSE

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great staff, great stay”
Reviews.Author: HardToPleaseSeattle
Reviews.Content: Had an absolutly great stay here. I stayed here when they opened in 2007 and the stay this time was even better. Close to everything and the staff bends over backwards to see that you are taken care of.

Reviews.Title: “very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: islandgirlavalon
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sofia with my daughter for a concert that was held right across the street. It was a perfect location, stores and restaurants all within walking distance. The hotel is adorable, small rooms but very clean a very nicely decorated. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “"Boutique" means Small Rooms! And beware the hidden charges! And location...”
Reviews.Author: capcity65
Reviews.Content: We had occasion to stay at this property for 3 nights on our SoCal vacation. A picture may tell a 1000 words, but it doesn't tell the whole story about this hotel. It has recently been down-graded to a 3-star hotel and rightfully so. The rooms are painfully small and all have double beds.
