You may require a bigger room if you were to spend longer there or for exampe if you needed to put down a travel cot. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Boutique Hotel in a Central Location.”
Reviews.Author: Seaforth35
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofia during a 2 night visit to San Diego and loved it! - The reception staff were friendly and helpful (allowing us to check-in early and giving us a top floor corner room with great views. ) - The room was well decorated and a decent size (if a bit smaller than the average US hotel room). - The location of the hotel was ideal for a city break, just a couple of blocks from the all the bars and restaurants in the GasLamp. We stayed in 5 hotels during our trip to CA and this was our favourite – If you like boutique hotels you’ll love the Sofia.

Reviews.Title: “Dog Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Mel_H_8
Reviews.Content: We checked prices online and then called the hotel directly. They matched the lowest online price and gave us a free room upgrade to a king because the queen wasn't actually available for all the nights of our stay. We brought our 50 lb. dog. There were a couple of extra fees to be aware of. Parking is valet only and $28/day. The valets were quick and friendly. There is a public garage for $15 a day about a block and a half to the southeast. There is also a $50 pet fee (per stay, not per night). The hotel staff were all friendly and smiled when they saw our dog. The room was very clean and comfortable with lots of extra pillows and towels. The bed and linens were very comfortable. The extra towels were necessary because the stand-up shower has a glass retaining wall for half its length and no door, so it splashes out quite a bit. The hotel was pretty quiet and we only heard our neighbors when they were opening and closing their closet. The halls are all pointed out from the building, so many rooms have windows facing rooms in the next hallway. We were disappointed at this set-up at first, but they put us the room closest to the elevator and stairs, which was ideal for taking the dog out to do her business. About a block south is a lawn to the federal building that even has a poop-bag dispenser (although it was empty during our visit). The hotel is next to a mall that is dog-friendly and a short drive from Balboa Park, where there is an off-leash fenced park. The restaurant in the hotel was pretty pricey ($15-20 for breakfast before beverages), but looked nice. There is also a Coffee Bean attached and an organic caterer that serves breakfast M-F across the street. Overall, the Sofia was a very comfortable and convenient place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: troylevy
Reviews.Content: Went for New Years with my wife. Perfect place for the price. Tiny rooms, but they are all redone and look pretty good. Starts getting into a part of downtown that may scare those from the suburbs.....but to you, i suggest going somewhere like Disneyland.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy boutique for cool people”
Reviews.Author: JCFElp
Reviews.Content: We were initially apprehensive about staying in a hotel with "small" rooms (as other reviewers mentioned), but we loved it! The hotel had history and charm and was still trendy and upscale. We got a good deal on Expedia for 4th of July weekend and went with the queensized room. The room was small but no space was wasted and the bed was amazingly comfortable. Our room was next to the elevator but there was no noise at all. We loved the staff, the service and the onsite bar/restaurant. If you are looking for a typical big chain hotel then this is not for you. If you are looking for something a little different, a little more hip, and you can handle a small space with awesome linens and decor, go for it! We enjoyed our stay immensely and will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique is Unique at The Sofia”
Reviews.Author: happycoupleGlasgow
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week at the Sofia. The hotel is magnificent and we have never experienced such incredible room service/cleaning. It was so lovely to stay at a small boutique hotel in an original building built in the 1940's. ideally located in the Gaslamp Quarter and yes is located right next to bus station but no noise or distrurbance experienced. There were a few vagrants hanging around but they did not bother us at all. Overall I would say this is a fabulous option when staying in San Diego and was a brillant end to our journey from the UK via our direct flight with Zoom airlines.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed experience”
Reviews.Author: Slangevar
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just had a mixed experience at the Sofia Hotel this weekend: THE GOOD: THE PRICE - The Sofia was almost half the price of our other favorite San Diego hotels. THE LOCATION - While the immediate neighborhood can have some sketchy characters (it's next to a bunch of bail bond shops and a Greyhound station), it's literally a couple of blocks from the Gaslamp, and never really felt unsafe. THE ROOM - The rooms are very clean and well decorated in a very attractive modern, but not overly flashy style (the photos they post are very accurate). We got a corner room with a nice view out of two of the windows, so the room felt a bit bigger than it might have otherwise. THE BUILDING - I think the Sofia might be a historical hotel, and it definitely does have more character than most of the Gaslamp hotels I've seen. Almost like an upscale NYC brownstone. THE BED - It's a good pillowtop bed with two duvets and nice, clean white sheets. It's no W heavenly bed, but it's comfortable. THE STAFF - Very helpful, professional desk staff. Not "warm," but on top of their game. THE BAD: THE WEBSITE - This is partly my fault, but I didn't realize until the day of our trip that the Sofia never sent me an email confirmation. We called and they did have the reservation, but this turned out to be a problem for the next reason. THE SURPRISE PRICE GOUGE - When we checked out, we noticed that our rate was $20 higher per night than quoted on their site. It wasn't taxes or fees... it was just $20 higher. Unfortunately we had no print out to prove it had gone up. If you book a room with them, make sure you print out the confirmation page and take it with you... it's the only time I've ever had this happen at a hotel and I've stayed at a LOT of hotels, both chain and independent. THE SOUND - The Sofia's walls are pretty thin, and in the morning, we were awakened at around 6 am by water in the pipes, doors shutting and people talking. THE WINDOWS - Don't open, which was surprising given the character of the hotel. We had to keep the A/C running all night just to eliminate the stuffiness. THE ROOM SIZE - They're smaller than normal American hotel rooms... more on par with European hotels I've stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “The Sofia Is Perfect”
Reviews.Author: junkiefortravel
Reviews.Content: So, I read several reviews of The Sofia and I was pretty confident in the research I'd done, most reviews were great....and then there were some not so great reviews that concerned me. But, I realize that different travelers have different needs and expectations. So here goes: My husband and I (early 30s and extensive travelers) stayed at the Sofia over Memorial Day weekend. We took the bus from the airport, 992 ($2.50 pp--exact change) and arrived at the Sofia within 15 mins of the airport. The Sofia's location is unbeatable. We were without a car for the trip, and it was totally fine. We walked to Balboa Park, the Embarcadero, Little Italy, and the eateries in the downtown/gas lamp area. We are very active and the walks didn't bother us one bit, but if you don't want longer walks, the bus stops right in front of the hotel. The hotel itself--perfect, boutique hotel. If you are used to chain hotels with huge rooms, this may not be it for you. If you like ornate features and if mileu matters to you, this could be the place for you. We had a standard room, which came with wonderful linens and a down comforter/duvet, and the bed was amazing--we have never enjoyed a hotel bed more than our own! The room had a flat-screen tv, small refrigerator, microwave, closet for hanging clothes and a small sitting area. The bathroom was also lovely, we liked the separate shower/toliet area from the sink...and I admit to being a bit snobbish about the toiletries, but these provided were really good quality. I could actually comb through my long hair after using their conditioner. The workout room was also well equipped with individual tv on each treadmill, weights and other equipment. I used the yoga studio 3x and I was the only person in there 2 out of 3 times. It was really peaceful and had a great set up. The hotel also offers bottled water, which is great. The service was also quite good and we didn't have any issues. However, I would suggest doing your own research at their internet area downstairs if planning to rent a car at last minute or doing an activity of some sort...not sure that the staff is up-to-date on pricing. The noise level of the hotel was fine, not a problem with their urban location, we weren't bothered one bit with city noise. The only noise we had was one night of partyers coming home late...

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully decorated, but thinnest walls ever!”
Reviews.Author: busytrainer
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sofia hotel while I was in town for a convention. It is in a very convenient location - in the evening we walked from the convention center through the Gaslamp Quarter and right to the hotel. There are many restaurants nearby, it is a very quick ride to the airport, and the corner coffee shop is a great plus! I had a queen room - very tight but fine for my needs. It was very clean and nicely appointed with an exceptionally comfortable bed and nice soft linens. My main complaint were the truly paper-thin walls. The first night after I went to bed my neighbor turned on his wall lamp by the bed and it was so loud I could have sworn he was turning on mine! I heard every word of his agitated morning phone call and could tell when my neighbors showered, flushed the toilet, or opened and closed their closets. I wouldn't say it's a show-stopper...the hotel is extremely nice...just think twice if you're a really light sleeper.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: uhoe
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided it was time to take a vacation with our dog instead of leaving him with my in-laws. We found this one and decided to try it out. When we arrived and were checking in the staff was very friendly and they even offered dog biscuits to our dog. They showed us places that were pet-friendly in town and were friendly every time we saw them. The room was a little smaller than we're used to and the shower kind of sucked because there was no way to close a door (because there wasn't one). The location was terrific and they even accepted a lower price we found on another website. We didn't get to try the Currant restaurant because they're not pet-friendly, but that's not their fault. All-in-all we were very satisfied and we're staying there again next time.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Experience”
Reviews.Author: JoiseyGrl
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 4 nights at the hotel while I was attending a conference at the Manchester Grand Hyatt. It was a nice experience. The room is smaller than normal but it was clean and nicely decorated. It's cozy for 2 people. I know there have been many complaints about the shower, but if you put the bathmat that is provided on the top of the ledge where you step into the shower and the rest extends onto the bathroom floor, it will absorb most of the splashing water. Also, aiming the shower head down will help too. The restaurant (Current) is not affiliated with the hotel but served a continental breakfast that was just perfect for me. The delicious cranberry nut muffins (my favorite) and fruit with coffee and juice was wonderful. They also had granola cereal with fresh strawberries and yogurt, several varieties of juices and the coffee was perfect. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I walked each morning to the conference (6 blocks away) and back in the afternoon. If I went out with other attendees at night and we would end up back at the Hyatt I would just take a taxi back to the Sofia. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “3.5*** - Nice, but a little odd”
Reviews.Author: pompom79
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sofia for 5 nights on a recent business trip and have a mixed opinion. The pluses for me were: - A lovely room for a great price: I booked one of the larger suites and was glad I did - using the fire exit map for scale, I figured out how small the regular rooms were and I would have gone stir-crazy, even as someone who is more than used to small European hotel rooms. The room itself was quite nicely decorated - chic but comfortable. The room rate was a great deal, especially as a large convention was in town and rooms were going for $300+/night at other nearby spots - I saw a great price for a Sofia suite on a 3rd party site and the hotel matched their rate for me. - A nice hotel in a decent location: The Sofia has been beautifully decorated - it maintains some of the charm of the original heritage building but with many modern conveniences. The location is convenient to the convention centre and Gaslamp District, and it's a short bus ride up in Balboa Park (the bus stops right outside the door). - The gym: Amazing gym! Top of the line cardio equipment (small personal tv screens with a headphone jack and a fan on each cardio machine) endless towels and bottled water, and not busy at all! The minuses? - Staff were hit or miss - the guys manning the bell stand were super friendly, but the girls behind the front desk were a little harried and came across a bit frosty. The housekeepers were all over the map - sometimes an obvious piece of trash would not be picked up or amenities would not be replenished, but other times everything was perfect. - No storage space - there was a very tiny closet in my room, with not enough room to stash my suitcase in, and the storage issue seems to extend to the housekeeping staff too - their carts would be parked in the halls for nearly whole days at a time. - The bus depot - the Greyhound depot is right behind the hotel and there can be some noise and characters hanging around at night. As a woman traveling alone, though, I never felt threatened - although the depot brings a few odd folks with it, it also means there are always taxis out front and people milling about at all hours. - Noise in general - if you're facing the rear of the building, you get bus depot noise; if you're facing the front, you get the random drunks coming out of the Gaslamp District late at night and the odd siren. As a city-dweller, I found the traffic and sirens to be fine but the random drunk yells to be really annoying. On top of that, the hotel's HVAC system is rather rattly so while having the a/c on drowns out city noise, it brings its own set of noises with it. - Quite possibly haunted - the room just felt spooky, period. I'm sure it's just wiring issues that go along with an old hotel, but lights would randomly go on in the room, stay on for an hour or so, then turn off just as mysteriously as they had turned on. I was charging my phone one night and from across the room, saw it light up as if someone had pushed a button yet I was the only one in the room. Overall, it was a decent stay and if looking for a cheaper option convenient to the downtown area, I'd go with the Sofia again. I'd bring earplugs and my husband, but I'd go again. if money was no object, though, I'd go back to the US Grant a couple blocks down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, some problems”
Reviews.Author: eckythump
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in November 2007. Location is excellent, downtown with a short walk to Horton Plaza and the Gaslamp Quarter. Because it is right next to the Greyhound station it does attract some homeless people, but we were never bothered once. San Diego is certainly not alone in having homeless people, and this is hardly the fault of the hotel. The room was very nice, albeit very small as other people have commented, though it's certainly not the smallest room i've ever stayed in. The room is tastefully decorated, the bed is very comfortable (didn't like the small pillows however), good selection of cable channels. The bathroom is very small, the sink is directly to the left as you walk in, and the shower has no screen so water tends to go all over the place, but that's what housekeeping is for. While the room itself was very nice, the hotel suffers from paper thin walls. We had loud drunken people in the next room to us who laughed and talked very loudly until very late (they finally quietened down by 2-3am). We could even hear when our neighbours turned their lights on and off. The other 2 nights we were fortunate to not have noisy people next door, but it really is just pot luck who you get. We are returning to San Diego in May and will be choosing another hotel to stay in due to the noise issue. The room was great, location great, very good value for money, but we value our sleep too much. There's nothing worse than being tired all day on vacation because of your noisy neighbours.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel in the heart of San Diego”
Reviews.Author: mekPhilly
Reviews.Content: Generally, this was a pleasant one-night stay. The hotel has been nicely refurbished and they seem interested in providing the little touches that might qualify the place as as boutique hotel. At check-in, the showed us a map of the rooms and asked us if a corner room would be ok (they are a little bigger). Rooms: clean, well decorated. Our bed was a queen and comfortable. Flat screen tv, microwave, mini fridge, safe and coffee maker. We were on the second floor and the view was the main disappointment. A roof from a lower building extended just below our window (see pictures) and those windows were covered with a metal mesh (security, I assume). I pulled down the shades and blocked that view, but naturally it made for a darker room. So, ask for a room higher up to avoid this. Higher rooms might also get you away from the street noise, as the hotel is located on a busy intersection. We live in a city, so it didn't wake us up but I can see how it might bother others. Internet access: Wifi in the lobby but ethernet connections ($10) in the room. Staff: Everyone was helpful, especially the concierge who recommended several nearby restaurants. Location: As noted by the other reviewers, the location is great and not-so great. Located in the heart of downtown, it is just a few short bocks to the Gas Lamp district, full of restaurants and shopping. But, it is also next to Greyhound, a bail bond shop and the San Diego County Jail on the next block. So, if you are used to staying in urban areas, you probably won't blink an eye. If not, it might make an impression. All told, walking around with my husband, I did feel safe at night. Parking: We parked our car with the valet, who was really friendly. There is metered parking surrounding the hotel but we didn't see much non-metered. $25 per night to valet park. Overall, a nice hotel. I wouldn't rush to return, but if the price was right, I wouldn't object to staying here a second time.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: colspghla
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofia hotel after another hotel could not accommodate our dog. The Sofia is pet-friendly (but just to be safe, do call ahead to double-check this). The staff was very courteous and friendly! The room was also nice - large double (may have been a queen?) bed that was very comfortable. An earlier review noted that the shower stalls don't have curtains, so yes some water will splash on the bathroom floor (just pretend you're staying in a European hotel). It wasn't a big deal at all. We stayed over a weekend, and while it is true that the hotel is by the Greyhound station and is downtown, I don't think the noise is too bad (if you're used to living in an urban area). It's a short walk to the Gaslamp quarter, and also to the marina area and the conference hotels. Parking is expensive, but it's expensive at all the downtown hotels. We recommend trying to find street parking nearby in the evening during the weekend and particularly if you're staying on a Saturday night, because you can then park all day Sunday in most spots south of the hotel. If you're staying on a weeknight, you could park at the San Diego concourse 2 blocks up. It is a bit sketchy (near the jail, etc.) but we had no problems. Overall, we enjoyed our stay, the hotel is comfortable, the staff friendly, and the location is good. If you don't mind all of the above in an urban setting (yes, there are homeless people in cities), this hotel is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: lucyfo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofia for 3 nights March 27-30 and loved it! This great hotel is perfectly located for the Gaslamp quarter and all bus routes to the beaches etc. The room was clean and very nicely decorated and the staff polite and helpful. We especially enjoyed the free internet access in the lobby - we had spent a fortune in internet cafes during other parts of our trip! All in all, a great hotel - would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Mini Vacation From Los Angeles”
Reviews.Author: Balconylove
Reviews.Content: We took our 15 and 17 year old kids to Sea World for Spring Break and a mini getaway. After reading nice reviews of the Sofia Hotel, and comparing prices of other nearby hotels, we chose the Sofia. What a great choice. After an exhausting full day at Sea World it took only ten minutes (all freeway) to arrive. Valet attendants were very accomodating, friendly and knowledgable. Check in was a breeze. We love boutique hotels and this one is exactly that! The rooms are small but very clean, modern, and cozy. Just a quick walk gets you to a whole bevy of fantastic restaurants nearby. We chose "Asti" (excellent Itallian!)There is also a mall right across the street. The restoration of original architecture in downtown is wonderful. The only downside, was the Greyhound station close-by, so there are vagrants walking around as most people would expect in most Downtown areas these days. Other than that..........I highly recommend this property for a nice San Diego get away and then some!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: jpfitzy7
Reviews.Content: The location of the Sofia can't be beat! Three blocks from the Gaslamp District with its night life and many food options, three blocks from the Seaport and ferry to Coronado, and one block from the trolley to Old Town. We found it very easy to navigate around the Sofia, and it's only an $11.00 cab ride from the airport. The room was nice but on the smaller side. This is a European style hotel so we expected that. Check in was super easy. The staff was great and eager to help find a place to eat or directions. Would definately stay here again, only recommend getting room in back of hotel. Had a corner room overlooking street and the noise at night was unbearable, with police and fire trucks going by as it is a very busy street.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jahjah01
Reviews.Content: An amazing hotel. Great room and guy. Friendly staff. Great location!

Reviews.Title: “Okay but expected more”
Reviews.Author: moncherrie
Reviews.Content: It was nice and the staff was very accommodating, but for the price, I did expect more.. One of our rooms had a coffee pot but they didn’t restock the coffee each day. Other room had plenty of coffee but no coffee pot. Finally, we were able to get one from housekeeping. If you need to be downtown this is an excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: WelshLady
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I have just come back from a 9 night stay at the Sofia and we loved this hotel. The location is great within easy walking distance of the Gaslamp quarter one way and the port with the Midway etc in the other direction. The hotel itself is smart and clean and I don't think the staff could have been anymore helpful. When we arrived the receptionist looked for a corner room for us as we were staying a while and they were bigger than some others which I thought was very nice. I would especially comment on Estefan (?) as he was extremely helpful. I only have one minor issue otherwise I would have given 5 stars instead of 4 and that was the due to it being an old building that had been recently refurbished the windows were only single pane and as Broadway is quite a busy street this did cause us to be woken in the middle of the night once by a fire engine going past. A shame but it would not stop me from staying there if I was in San Diego again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed”
Reviews.Author: memcadman
Reviews.Content: I stayeed here while attending a conference at the convention center. The hotel is within walking distance of the Gas Lamp Quarter as well as trolley stops. I was very impressed with the helpfulness of the staff. I would definately stay here again next time I am in San Diego. The only thing I didn't like was the shower. While it has great water pressure, it was only partially enclosed with a glass partition and no curtain. As a result when you got out of the shower the floor was covered in water.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Princess_Pudding
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 days in San Diego post cruise, and we chose the Sofia Hotel mainly based on its central location. We were not disappointed! We were booted off the cruise ship early in the morning, and by 9:30am, we were at Sofia Hotel. To our delight, they have a room ready for us overlooking Broadway. The room was small, but fully functional. We had windows on 2 walls so the room was nice and bright. We were centrally located and within walking distance to the gaslamp district, Little Italy, and even the seaport village. (we do like to walk...) Horton's Plaza was just a few blocks away from the hotel and definitely not to miss. We bought a $5 day pass and used the public transit (Blue line convieniently located just a block away) to get to Old Town and Balboa Park. Pros: - location, location, location - very friendly staff - free internet access - within walking distance of many restaurants and shopping centre Cons: - the room a bit small - the shower was separated by a glass pane, but not enough to prevent water from splashing everywhere - only continental breakfast available in the morning in the restaurant (Currant) - so if you are looking for a hot breakfast, you will have to go elsewhere. However, the continental breakfast was delicious, with pastries, plenty of fruits and yummy yogurt.

Reviews.Title: “A long weekend in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: cmcfong
Reviews.Content: I met a group of friends in San Diego. We booked the Sofia. $99 per night for a room with one or two queen beds, $149 per night for a suite. The rooms are very small, so the suite worked best for those who were sharing. Good value . What we liked: front desk staff: very nice and accomodating amenities: great linens and free bottled water, microwaves, fridge and coffee maker in room (7/11 nearby)free internet in lobby and three computers plus a printer for guest use beds: VERY nice, quite comfortable Rooms are as noted very compact. They are well decorated and efficiently planned. The curtains are heavy and I was never disturbed by street noise (room 304) Common areas are well decorated and make great conversation areas (despite the Christmas decor which is still up...a little wierd but tasteful) Walking tour offered for free on Sat and Sunday morning. Excellent, just over an hour touring the Gaslamp district, Embarcadero and waterfront. Very well done. Location: It was very easy to walk to shops , restaurants, and clubs. Train and trolley very near by. Taxis always at the stand. On site restaurant, Currant, and the bar: Loved this. The bar is very attractive, albeit rather noisy when the Charger fans are in high gear. Good happy hour. The dinner at the restaurant was excellent. We had the breakfast buffet every morning. Good strong coffee, house made pastries of extremely high quality, fresh berries, melon and pineapple, house made granola and french toast, and yogurt for $9.99. Perfect for us. Restaurant staff is very good, well informed, courteous and helpful. What we didn't like: Housekeeping, capricious at best. Some days they came, some days they didn't. I left most mornings by 7 and twice returned to change for dinner around 6 and the room had not been cleaned. Several of our group had delayed checkin and two were checked into rooms which had not been cleaned. (there are some management issues at the hotel, staff communication is not good. Checkout was slow for several people.) Bathrooms: nearly all of us commented on this. They don't have a complete shower closure, a half wall of glass in the European style which yielded a wet (as in soaking) floor after showers The bathroom door is a sliding glass (frosted) door which never fully shuts. Not a good thing in a shared room. No exhaust fan. The sink is on a stand outside the bathroom and is sloped so that if the water comes on a bit fast it will slosh all over the floor. The best thing about the hotel is the very pleasant and accomodating front desk, in particular, Brian. The worst thing about the hotel is housekeeping. Although the rooms were well cleaned, the problem was they were slow and not consistent. Also small maintenance issues which housekeeping should note and have resolved before check in of the next guest weren't addressed.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Sofia”
Reviews.Author: rdrgrl724
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sofia for one night on New Year's Eve. I traveled with some girlfriends and the three of us stayed in a standard room. Although the room was on the small side, we loved the modern look of the hotel. It was well-situated on the corner with lots of options for restaurants and fast food nearby. We were even able to walk about four blocks to the gaslamp district. The room was clean, beds were comfortable and soft with great sheets and comforters. Unfortunately parking was $25 a night, as stated in other reviews but it seems to be pretty usual for most hotels in the area. I would recommend this place for a great stay and I will definitely be coming back this summer when the weather is warmer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Pleasent stay.”
Reviews.Author: shashaedmontonCanada
Reviews.Content: Prior to our cruise in Dec we stayed at the Sophia. We already anticipated the small rooms, and the usual scenes that go on in a downtown area. Like the homeless ect... But they never bothered us. The staff was very helpful and we received a free upgrade. Yes the room is small, but it was clean and updated. The location is very convenient. Within a few blocks is a major shopping complex, transportation system (which is easy to navigate), gaslamp quater, great restaraunts, the old town trolly tours (highly reccomend). It's a shrt drive from the airport and the pier as well. If location and cleanliness is your thing this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Just got back”
Reviews.Author: webeenthere
Reviews.Content: Very well renovated, very clean, friendly staff, great location in downtown San Diego. Fully equiped fitness room. No pool or whirlpool for the tired feet. The rooms are small but useable and fully equiped with fridge and microwave, very comfortable beds, shower only in the bathrooms. The restaurant was pricey with limited menu but fairly good. Overall, very satisified with the hotel and the cost of accomodation. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Not for families with kids”
Reviews.Author: Obelixta
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights with 2 young kids. - The suite we stayed was small for the $ we paid. - Parking in the hotel is $25 per night - go figure. We parked two nights in the street and to feed the parking meters was no fun. - There is no free laundry in the hotel. While this is a great hotel for a business trip, for a family of 4 with two young kids, if you have to wash your clothes mid way through the trip, you can either use the terribly expensive laundry service or search for a laundromat. Definitely not recommended for families with young children.

Reviews.Title: “It's Okay”
Reviews.Author: Travel_noise
Reviews.Content: It is a nice hotel with beautiful contemporary rooms that are well maintained. The staff was okay. The front desk clerks seemed to have difficulty in understanding basic issues and did not seem to really answer questions. I stated in my reservations that I would be coming in late after 12:00AM. When I arrived at the hotel at 1:15 AM the clerk told me he assumed since I had not arrived by 12:30 I was not coming and had erased my reservation, however he had still charged my credit card. Nevertheless, the clerk still found me a room. Upon checkout I asked the clerk to check my billing since they had already charged my credit card. It was indicated by the billing statement that everything was in order so I left. Upon arrival to my home the next day I found that I had been overcharged for one day. To date this issue has not been resolved. It is within walking distance of the convention center and mall. The largest downfall is that the hotel is right next to the bus station.

Reviews.Title: “It's just ok”
Reviews.Author: drcomposting
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for three nights for a big conference with more than eighteen thousand attendance. I booked this hotel using conference rate when all the other major downtown hotels were booked out, for approximately $150 / night. The location was fine, except it’s next to a greyhound station. The convention center is within distance (20 min) but it’s better you bring a pair of walking shoes. The hotel is clean. The room is so small to a point, which is making me uncomfortable. It kind of reminded me of the inexpensive hotels I stayed in NYC. Unfortunately they don’t have wireless and they were unable to provide a longer Ethernet cable, so I wasn’t able to use my laptop on my bed. The hotel restaurant is new and seems to have a very good wine selection. Its room rate (either conference rate or regular rate) isn’t a lot less than other the premium Gaslamp hotels. You might want to pay 20 – 30% extra for a bigger room in a more convenient location, particularly if you’re traveling with somebody.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay with a European feel”
Reviews.Author: TravelDuoAD
Reviews.Content: We spent Thanksgiving week at the Sofia Hotel. We called the Hotel directly to book and they beat the best price we found online. When we checked in we upgraded our room to a King Deluxe. The room was small but well layed out with plenty of shelves and drawers for storage. I found the decor to be very similar to upscale European hotels I have stayed in, understated earth tones and clean lines. Our room was on the 2nd floor so we were able to access the free lobby wi-fi from the room. Hotel internet would normally be 9.95 a day for an Ethernet plug in which we were not looking forward too. The room has a shower (no tub) and the bathroom sink is a console unit outside the bathroom. This is a great set up for two people to get ready. There is a refrigerator, microwave and lap top size safe in the room. The decor of the hotel celebrates the history and we enjoyed checking out the many photos of the hotel in it's original form. We loved the location - Horton Plaza and the Gaslight District are in close walking distance. We found it easy to get in and out of the city from this location (close to 163/downtown). There is a small amount of public parking in the area but we used the valet ($25). The room was such a great price that even with valet it was a better deal than most hotels we looked at. We did not have very much interaction with the hotel staff but found them all wonderful and very helpful. The bar staff were very friendly and the restaurant serves a contemporary American Menu until 10 PM. We were attracted to this hotel because of the great price, central location and clean European decor and we were not disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Hmm, nice but tight”
Reviews.Author: travelgal75
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well appointed, as spelled out by other reviewers, and the service was fine. I stayed at this hotel while attending a major conference in early Nov 2007. Although I made the reservations for the hotel months in advance, when I arrived there was a possibility that I would not have a room, as the hotel was so overbooked. (For me, this was not unexpected, as this is a common occurrence with hotels when serving patrons for this particular conference.) The staff members were very apologetic for this trouble, and after some time, my reservation was found, and I was placed in a very VERY small, but well decorated, room. I originally planned to share my room with a colleague, but with the severe lack of space, and the fact that the bathroom door (which was in view from all points in the very small room) consisted of opaque glass, these plans had to be changed. Like the room, the bathroom was also very small, and was designed such that when one stepped out of the shower one was stepping in front of the bathroom door. As my colleague and I had no interest in seeing each other naked from the other side of the glass door, my colleague chose to find other arrangements. This left me to pay for the room ($175/night) by myself. Notably, the room would be fine for couples, but it was simply not possible to share this room with a friend. I also noticed that many other rooms in this hotel appeared to be much larger than the one we were placed in, so this may have been just the luck of the draw. But we had asked for a 2 person room, so it's possible that others may have a similar experience. If you are concerned about this, I would ask in advance about rooms for 2 people that would be suitable for non-couples. The restaurant associated with the hotel was good and very well decorated, but expensive. For example consider the breakfast options: $10 for your choice of plain yogurt, granola, fruit, muffins, and coffee; $17 if you want eggs and toast with that. Luckily I am a light eater, and so the first option more than met my needs. It was convenient that the hotel offers wireless access in the lobby, as well as 3 computers with internet access (and possibly a printer) to its patrons. All in all an average boutique hotel, with a big price tag.

Reviews.Title: “Location,Location,Location”
Reviews.Author: woofwoof
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic place, great location,service the best we found in the States, very very helpfull nothing was a problem. We had no problems walking around the city as everything was close.Found great restaurants, some hidden gems ,which we will be passing onto other Aussie travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for the price”
Reviews.Author: smartfortrip
Reviews.Content: We were looking for the good price and at the same time nice hotel. We were able to book the Sofia Hotel through priceline for $102/per night. When coming to the hotel, I and my husband were worried that the location is right on the busy intersection and we would be able to hear the noise. Therefore, we asked for the room on the top floor - 7th and were pleasantly suprised that the noise is subtle. The room itself is very small, but everything is smartly planned. The only problem that we experienced was the noise coming from the air conditioner. I asked the receptionist to see if we can check other rooms, but the noise is the same is other rooms as well. So, we did not change anything. The personnel is very pleasant and is willing to assist. The location of the hotel is great: walking distance to the center of the city, sea port (15-20 mins), mall, and bunch of restaurants. For the tourists, I recommend to take the bus tour: Hop on Hop off and to check online for the discounts possible before you buy it through the hotel itself. The bus stops 5 mins away from the hotel and its a great way to see the whole city. Also, recommend to take the ferry boat to go to the Coronada Island. The prices are though pretty high for the area and if you get a car and drive a bit, you can get better deals. for restaurants. Definetly try the sushi place located across the street from the hotel, they have very good sushi and prices. Overall, we were satisfied with the hotel, service and location. Would definetly recommend for people who dont really need a car to get around, short stay and are willing to stay in a budget but comfortable way.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at The Sogia”
Reviews.Author: Emily0000
Reviews.Content: Prior to my stay I saw a critical review of the Sofia and was a bit concerned about my upcoing stay. I did not need to worry! The hotel is nicely designed, the lobby comfortable and attractive. The rooms, while not large had wonderfully comfortable beds, lots of soft pillows, damask sheets, and down comforters. The drapes kept the room nice and dark. The decor is contemporary, but not cold, and the amenities seemed consistent with a much more expensive property. The staff were friendly and helpful and I enjoyed that they had three free compters available for guests to check e-mail and get on-line. I recommend the hotel highly. Emily

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: productionguru
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel in a prime location right in downtown San Diego. Spoke with Christian on the phone to make reservation and was offered a great room with a very nice view. Some reviews panned the location as being seedy, but from what I saw it was no different than any other major city. A little street smarts will take you a long way. Rooms are quite small, but are very clean and comfortable. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a weekend!”
Reviews.Author: HeySchloopy
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I met in San Diego for a weekend and found a great deal on Orbitz for the Sofia Hotel. The room was quite small- we had two double beds which made for some traffic jams in the mornings. The room was well appointed and had a modern flair. The parking was a bit excessive at $25 a day, however the valet service was excellent. They were friendly and accommodating no matter how many times in one day we needed our car! The hotel staff was extremely friendly and helpful. They helped find a small restaurant and printed directions for us. They also printed my boarding pass for my outgoing flight. The staff were good a recognizing faces and asking how our daily adventures were going. The location is great for some out of the ordinary dining and moderate end shopping. Definately a great hotel for casual traveling. We wanted nothing to do with cell phones, computers or television so I cannot comment from a business perspective.

Reviews.Title: “Consider the options”
Reviews.Author: Mid-40-married
Reviews.Content: My wife an I stayed at the hotel for our 12 anniversary. We stayed in a suite. I requested a higher floor because of the noise of the street traffic. I ended up getting a 2nd floor room according to the desk clerk there were no other rooms available, at 6:00 PM? I think the room was very small but nicely decorated. A regular room is tiny. Too small in my opinion. It is not a totally renovated hotel. The window molding had layers of paint chipped and painted over. The neighborhood is "Transitional" it is close to the Gas lamp area but not in it. It is close to a great shopping mall. There are a lot of homeless people in the immediate area of the hotel. It is next to the greyhound bus station. I could see evidence of public urination near the hotel in the morning. You will without a doubt be hit up for money by the homeless when you venture out of the hotel. Maid service at this hotel was lame. The walls had marks where suitcases from previous guests had left marks. They could have been easily cleaned. I found a used condom on the floor next to the bed under the bed skirt. Disgusting. We went out at 9 am and left the make up room sign till 4 pm when we returned the room had not been serviced. We wanted to relax before we went out for dinner but had to leave the room while a maid cleaned up the room. The air conditioner was so loud that it made listening to the TV at reasonable volume impossible.I paid $25 a day for parking. I thought it would be covered garage in the hotel. My car was parked in an open lot in a neighborhood that I would have never parked my car in had I known. My car was returned covered with city dust and bird poop. We told the manager at the front desk about the problems we had encountered when we checked out. He didn't seem to care he was also being hammered by another unhappy guest who was complaining as well.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased with the Sofia Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pattis_Zone
Reviews.Content: This is actually the historic Pickwick Hotel from 1929 looking glorious in its refurbished state. The Pickwick had become a run-down slum and was remodeled and reopened in late 2006 as the Sofia. Some of the staff stayed on after the Pickwick was closed and worked on the construction crew to see it through and now are once again working in the beloved hotel as porters, desk clerks and cleaning staff. The hotel has a distinct European feel with friendly staff. The rooms are fabulous. The beds and bedding are the best! The shower does only have a one half glass panel instead of a curtain or shower door. The very stylish above counter basin is located outside the bathroom with very nice lighting for getting ready while the other person is showering. The room is full of useful amenities such as coffee maker, refrigerator, microwave and desk. There is a restaurant downstairs that serves a very pricey buffet breakfast for $15 per person. At second street and broadway is the St. Tropez cafe serving very good lunches and breakfasts. This bistro is located right across from the San Diego Tourist Information center across from Horton Plaza at Broadway Circle. This hotel is only a 5-6 block walk from the train station and not much further from the cruise terminal. It is very close to Horton Plaza. We loved this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Sofia in San Diego -- Great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: timonier
Reviews.Content: Traveled to San Diego on U.S. Government business. I googled the place and saw that it was across the street from where I needed to be. Called the hotel directly and asked if they had the government rate to which they immediately replied, "Yes!" I booked my stay. The hotel is apparently a renovation of an old run-down place. They did a terrific job. Beautifully and tastefully decorated. Service was attentive and excellent. Rooms are a bit on the small side, but it was of no concern. Easy walk to many places to eat and shop. I recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Cincy05
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great especially if you plan on spending a lot of time in the downtown area. The hotel itself is nice. The rooms were very clean and cozy. The reviews are correct when talking about the size of the rooms, the rooms are quite small. That was fine for us because we were not in the room very much other than to sleep and rest up before dinner. The resturant in the lobby level of the hotel looked nice, we did not go there. Overall we liked the hotel, improvements that can be made are with staff. They were nice, but not very knowledgable about the area and when we asked questions about different things in the city, that lack of knowledge showed. If you are looking for a nice place to stay, a great price, and central location, the Sofia would be the place!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: centralparkhero
Reviews.Content: The Sofia has a great location, clean rooms, and a nice bar that's just opened downstairs. The problem is that the rooms are very, very small. This is fine if you're not there for very long, we were only there for one night, or not planning to spend much time in your room. Overall, depite the lack of size, this was one of our better hotels on our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Business travelers beware”
Reviews.Author: rpurington
Reviews.Content: I will not stay at this hotel again. Upon arrival I was told that I was double-booked. I checked with Expedia and my bank and that was not true. The room was newly renovated but very small. The internet access turned out to be wired-only with a $9.95/day surcharge. They provide awful brew-your-own coffee in the room and nothing in the hotel lobby. Parking is by valet only and they charge $25 a day. I probably could overlook the above but what occurred on checkout was an absolute disgrace. During my stay I noticed that my cell phone was not working well (it's a very reliable quad-band cell phone that i have used globally). The building is an old structure that is not suitable for cell communications. During the course of a conversation with an important customer, I was forced to terminate the call and quickly use the hotel landline for a US domestic call. The call lasted about 45 minutes. When I got my bill at checkout they charged me over $1.00 per minute for the call. I was in a rush to get to the airport so I could not address this with the management staff in person. When I called back and talked to the manager (Christian) he agreed to only refund about $30 of the $58 phone charge. The fact that a company would think they could get away with such outrageous charges in today's world is simply unbelieveable.. It appears they haven't noticed that long distance is a commodity with fiercely competitve rates. My advice is to stay away - take your business to a company that doesn't try to generate revenue through "gotcha" practices like this.

Reviews.Title: “Great modern look to a traditional building”
Reviews.Author: jason2004simba
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! What more can i say about the sofia it is in a great location to explore the city especially if you are on foot. The car valets are extremely helpful and friendly giving tips on getting in and around the city by car if need be. The rooms are clean,modern and spacious enough to feel at home. A nice touch is the free internet in the business centre - It offers quick internet access with a colour printer as gratis. We would always stay here if in the area and would employ others to do so - We can praise the hotel and the staff enough.

Reviews.Title: “Sophia Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JustMe067
Reviews.Content: Rooms were small but very comfortable and updated nicely. In the hallways you could hear noise from inside other rooms, but once inside your room it was very quiet. Staff was very helpful from the front desk to the conceirge. Very close to the hub of public transportation (buses, trolleys) and within walking distance of gas lamp district for dining and nightlife. There is free wifi in the lobby as well as 3 workstations for use and for an additional fee there is internet access in individual rooms. Overall it was a very pleasurable experience. The building was historical, but once inside it had a modern flair to the spaces.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stylish and Urban”
Reviews.Author: marysuonno
Reviews.Content: I spent four days at the Sofia in August and it was a great experience. The hotel is comfortable, nicely decorated, and extremely clean. It has a minimalist and urban style that make you feel like you are staying at a much more expensive hotel. The staff is friendly and extremely willing to help in any way. The location is perfect, close to airport, downtown, Balboa park, and the highway to the beaches, all this but without being a huge eyesore chain hotel in a tourist district. Others have complained about parking, but I didn't rent a car, and with its convenient location near public transportation, gaslight district, and cabs, there was no need. The rooms are small, but this didn't bother me, I was looking to spend a lot of time inside. I would totally return, and recommend this place to anyone who likes sleek, stylish hotels with great service and good price.

Reviews.Title: “Superb service, small rooms, luxurious experience”
Reviews.Author: Frogberto
Reviews.Content: I learned about the Hotel Sofia through trip advisor, and the reviews seemed spot on. What really stood out for me about this hotel was the great service - the valets were friendly and helpful, the pullman/bellboy was extremely nice, and the desk clerks and concierge made really excellent suggestions and had a wonderful demeanor. Whatever the employees are eating or drinking, they need to export it to other hotels. Another positive is the location - close to horton plaza, the gaslamp district, and one block or so away from the train station, right in the heart of downtown. The rooms are tastefully modern and well decorated, and they make the most out of the smaller rooms. The negatives would be the lack of self parking - paying $25 a day for valet parking (plus tip) is steep, even if the hotel is downtown. The rooms also were small, as mentioned, and the air conditioning seemed to only work after a few hours. The windows had paint on them and would not open - not that the view of the greyhound bus station was anything to stare at anyway. Overall, however, I think it's a bargain at the $195 price we found, and it's a hotel I would recommend to those that need or want to stay in Downtown San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Returned to Honeymoon site”
Reviews.Author: Radke
Reviews.Content: We read the reviews for the Sofia before booking our stay, and were able to request a room in the front of the hotel, away from the bus station. We took our dog, and it was important for it to be quiet, since our dog barks at any noise and keeps us up at night if there is a lot of noise around. She didn't do that, and we slept well. The rooms are small, but it's an old hotel and you have to understand that they've kept the integrity of the old building and made their rooms comfortable. The shower was a little weird, but it didn't ruin our stay. We just didn't blast the water. The bathroom was very nice. Nice tile, colors, and feel. Our room had its own refrigerator and microwave, that made it easy for us to have a cup of tea in the morning. The gym was excellent for its size. The Eliptical Trainers and the Treadmills were all modern, with built-in fans and televisions. The gym had clean towels available, and bottled water. The staff left bottles of water in the room, also, so we had fresh water most of our stay. Next door was a "yoga" room, which we used to stretch. The one pain was relying on the valet service. Although they were efficient, it's a bit of a problem to always have to wait for your car. And the hotel charges a daily rate, but they don't tell you that the valet service isn't connected to the hotel. So on top of the rate, you feel compelled to tip, which makes it a rip-off. If we're paying $25 a day, you'd think the tip would be included. Especially if you are "required" to use the service. I guess we could have shopped around, but we were looking for convenience. The valet staff did leave us with a reminder scratch on one of the sides of our car. Overall, a nice experience. We would return if given the chance.

Reviews.Title: “NICE START TO HONEYMOON”
Reviews.Author: californiagirl82
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel although the bedrooms were quite small. Check-in was fast, reception staff were helpful and pleasant. The hotel does not provide breakfast although they recommended a good cafe a few blocks away which served delicious bagels. It is quite a central location to tour San Diego! Really loved this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice find!”
Reviews.Author: SWFAN
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Sofia for the San Diego Comic-con. It was a great hotel. It was clean, the maids were wonderful, the hotel was in a great location. It was also very quiet. The day service was magnificent, howeverthe night staff was not so good. Our phone in the room kept flashing red like we had a message. We didn't notice it until night, it looked like a disco. We informed the front desk in the morning and they apologized and said they would get it fixed right away. We got back late that night and found the issue still happening. We called down to the front desk and they told us to just unplug the phone. Well that's fine except when we need a wake up call. We also asked for a cab early Sunday morning to go to the airport and it wasn't done. We hailed a cab ourselves. The room was very modern and clean. I only have two complaints about the room, it was tiny - smaller than a NY hotel and the shower is "modern" with only half of a door. After the first day, we started asking the maids for extra towels and this problem was solved. The bed was comfortable and the linens were nice. This hotel is close to the trolley, it' jut 2 blocks to a station. It also borders Horton Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “good pick”
Reviews.Author: ComfortWise
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sofia Hotel the end of April through May 1, 2007. I was skeptical that the place would be acceptable given recent renovations but rooms in San Diego were tight. I was pleasantly surprised. As other reviewers pointed out, the hotel is near the bus station and one can expect the associated traffic. (Then again, the Westgate where I was supposed to stay is only a block or two further away.) The staff was a little green but pleasant. The beds were comfortable as well and the room neat and clean (I had a suite). My room was near the front of the hotel on the second floor and as such I expected street noise. The noise level was surprisingly low in that location. Should the situation arise, I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Had A Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: parachutes28
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sofia on a recent weekend trip to San Diego and had a great time. Its in a great location and the staff was superb - extremely friendly - each one greeted us every time we returned - and very helpful for area information. The hotel is very sleek and rooms were kept clean. The gym was excellent - very high tech machines and the free business center was very convenient. The only draw back was the slightly small rooms - a room with two double beds was a little cramped for four people. I'd stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Only so-so”
Reviews.Author: TravelbirdSanDiego
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Sofia. This cute little boutique hotel has only been open for about 3 months, so there are still various bugs to be worked out. First: When we arrived to check in, someone had mistakenly cancelled our reservation. The young, nervous employee working at the front desk was polite and quickly attempted to remedy the error. We had booked a King room, and apparently he was having trouble finding us an available KIng, and asked if we would mind a Queen. I politely said no, that we really preferred a King, and he continued to look in the computer. Then he said "I will try and upgrade you to a suite." Of course I assumed that he meant that the only KIng beds available were in suites, and that he was going to upgrade us as a gesture of goodwill to make up for the hotel's error. I thanked him for his help, went up to my suite, and found...a Queen bed. When we called down, we were told, "Oh no, all suites have Queen beds." Grrrrr. Staff here is friendly but generally immature. One gets the feeling that they had to staff this brand new hotel quickly, and filled all the openings with young, inexperienced kids. Nice, friendly, polite, but ineffective. The other major problem, (which may not be a problem for some), was that the room had vents in the ceiling through which came a constant loud sound of air/machinery/water running...? A constant humming, like louder-than-normal "white noise." After some investigation we learned that all the rooms have this noise, and apparently lots of people don't even notice it. SO if you are the sort of person who likes white noise when falling asleep, this probably won't bother you. For us, it felt like trying to sleep in a comfy (albeit Queen) bed on a 747. On the positive side: Good location, cute, clean rooms, nice toiletry products, nice soft linens, excellent hairdryer, flat screen TVs, no street noise (probably because of super-loud white noise!) Probably would not stay here again. Maybe in a few years, when it "grows up" a bit.

Reviews.Title: “Sofia...Not as Good as it Could Be...”
Reviews.Author: vmsPhiladelphia
Reviews.Content: Visited The Sofia in April 2007- The Good: 1) Lovely contemporary appearance, spa like environment, 2) convenient location (close to airport and all downtown sites such as Gaslamp, Balboa, Seaport, Old Towne...these are all an easy walk or quick bus/trolley ride). 3)Lobby area is very comfortable with a fireplace, plasma TV and very comfortable seating. 4) Common area with three computers for internet access in addition to the rooms. This also allows wireless access so you can use your own computer. 5)Housekeeping is very efficient, you don't often see their carts crowding the halls and they didn't seem to arrive at inconvenient times. The Bad: 1) VERY NOISEY! Regardless of which side or end of the building you are on, the noise makes it difficult to sleep. If you are on the back side of the building, you overlook a bus terminal. We had one of these rooms for 2 nights. You hear buses idling and squealing brakes all night long. Don't believe the people at the front desk when they tell you the buses aren't allowed to idle... they do. In addition, there are some commercial buildlings adjacent to the bus terminal...a trash truck arrives between 6:30-7:15 am to empty the 4-5 large dumpsters (skips). Not only do you have to listen to the back-up beeping (beep, beep, beep, beep...) you have to listen to the sound of the metal dumpsters being moved around, clamped in, placed back on the ground and rolled back into place. Over and over. It seemed like the process took 2 hours...it was probably more like 30 minutes. Also, there is a police station in the back area so every time a call came in (surprisingly many), you have to listen to blasting police and fire-rescue sirens. Ok, so after the second sleepless night, we asked to be moved to a quieter room. We were moved to the street side (Broadway). This is a major multi-lane street with non-stop traffic. Our third night was also sleepless. On our 4th night we discovered the alarm clock had background noise like rain, water, animals...we used this to block the street noise. Rain is the best for this. 2) No room service of any kind and the only place to get something convenient is Wendy's, a coffee shop that closes rather early or 7-eleven. That's about it. They have a sign showing a new restaurant opening Spring 2007...Current...a Scandinavian style place but it didn't seem to be too far along. 3) The gym in "hidden". 4) Many, but not all, of the front desk staff are very arrogant. Upon check-in, 9:30 pm on a Saturday night we inquired about a place to eat. We advised them we would like non-smoking (we forget Cali. is non-smoking). The person checking us in looked up with a sneer and said, "We totally hate disgusting smokers!" Now, I am not a smoker and I don't appreciate smoke in any way and avoid going any place that allows smoking but his attitude was very nasty. On our 4th night, we were watching TV at about 10:00 pm and someone attempted to enter our room...over and over...I peeped through the peep hole and saw people with a passkey that was obviously working but being blocked by the deadbolt angrily trying to force their way in. I advised them they had the wrong room and sent them back to the front desk. I called the front desk immediately and informed them of the situation. The young lady told me she would correct the problem Ten minutes later our phone rang and she started giving me the third degree about what I was doing in the room etc. I told her the story about switching rooms after the second night. She told me in a very terse tone, "I plan to investigate this!" and hung up. A few minutes later she called again and I once again explained the room switch and reminded her that we were in this room for two days. She cut me off and told me she would call me right back. I waited about 15 minutes and called her. She cut me off again and said, "I told you, I'm investigating this." Thirty minutes later a gentleman called and once again asked me to explain the situation. At this point I was very frustrated and was a little short with him. He hung up. A few minutes he called back and told us he figured out what happened so the problem was resolved...he just hung up. No explanation, no apology...just hung up. 5) As others have said, the rooms are very small. There isn't any room to walk around or spread out. However, if you are single or a couple without children and don't really hang-out in your room, it isn't a problem. 6) The bathrooms are tiny. When you walk into your hotel room, you are immediately next to the bathroom sink...it is not in the actual bathroom. In an area the size of a closet you will find the toilet and very small shower with a 1/2 glass wall...horizontal not vertical. The floor is soaked after every shower regardless of how careful you are. We are small people but the amount of water on the floor looked like ducks were bathing in the room. To sum it up, if the hotel spent some money sound proofing the place ...(new window are a good start; still have the ancient windows with single pane glass), I would definitely stay there again despite the size and lack and lack of some "luxuries". The constant noise just makes it unpleasant. You feel exhausted by the end of your stay. Oh, by the way, if you haven't been to San Diego, be prepared for an onslaught of homelessness all around the hotel. You can barely take a step without tripping over someone sleeping on the street outside the hotel or nearby businesses.

Reviews.Title: “Wow - what a Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WearyWorkTraveller
Reviews.Content: Expensive (I was there during a couple of trade shows) - but well worth it. Beautiful place great view - try to get a corner room - I had room #700 and room #200 - both were EXCELLENT. There was ZERO noise, and the staff is the friendliest I have ever encountered. Well worth the money. The only bad thing is the bums in downtown San Diego - but that is in now way the Sofia's fault.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome staff”
Reviews.Author: lvtravelngirl
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at the Sofia Hotel Easter Weekend (even though we were in town for Opening Weekend at Petco Park!) I absolutely loved it! ROOMS: My friend was a bit disappointed at the size of the room-- they are small; but it was just the two of us and it was fine. We had a king bed room- we peeked into a 2 queen bed room- I would say that we had a bit more space in our room. The only thing I didn't really like about the room was the shower- there is no shower door nor curtain, just a glass spacer so the floor was soaked by the time each of us showered. I absolutely loved the way the rooms were decorated and furnished and the bed was SOOOO comfortable! STAFF: All the employees we encountered were FABULOUS!!! The men at the bell desk/concierge were GREAT!!! The staff was helpful and friendly. LOCATION: It was within walking distance of Petco Park and the Gaslamp District. At night, it seemed to get kind of sketchy-- If I were there alone (without my male friend), I probably would not have walked around at night- I probably would have taken a cab. The WORST part of our stay was the expensive valet parking. Although, the prices at the Sofia are on par with other hotels in the area. We only took the car out once the whole weekend we were there- I wish there was a discounted rate on park n stow vs. daily in-out privileges-- this is the only thing I would change about my stay and the hotel. I would absolutely stay there again and would MOST definitely recommend it to friends wishing to stay near downtown/Gaslamp areas.

Reviews.Title: “Not for travelers with children - Parking $25 per day”
Reviews.Author: stephinlv
Reviews.Content: This hotel was more for single, solo travelers. The rooms were 12 x 12, fitting two queen beds, two massive pieces of furniture. There were...no kidding...2 feet in between all the pieces of furniture. Definitely not suitable for those people traveling with children. Bathroom was aesthetically pleasing but not functional - almost a safety hazzard. Also - parking is $25 per day and valet was mandatory. Definitely an excellent location though - within walking distance to great shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel...Couldn't be better!”
Reviews.Author: greatday-7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Sofia during a business trip that we extended into a short vacation. This property worked great for both. For business, it was close to the convention center. Our company also had a meeting at the hotel and the facility was wonderful. For fun, this hotel was close to everything including the Gaslamp District. The location could not get any better. The hotel provided some great services that we have not seen anywhere else, including a complimentary San Diego Walking Tour. The staff was also incredibly friendly. Overall, this was a great value for Downtown San Diego. We will be back!
